societies.name: A Cappella
societies.description: The Imperielles (all-female, contemporary) The Scopes (mixed, contemporary) Take Note (all-female, barbershop) The Techtonics (all-male, contemporary) Surcery (mixed, fusion style) Nth Harmonic (mixed, contemporary/close harmony) All of these groups were founded within the past 14 years, and range in intensity and development. Activities undertaken by the groups include an all-expenses paid tour to Hong Kong (which included two performances to a sold-out 3500-seater stadium), appearing on TV shows, winning and placing highly at international competitions in NYC, semi-professional tours to all over America and Canada, celebrity-endorsed professional music videos, studio recorded albums, sell-out performances at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, corporate backed flash mobs and much much more... but above all we love having fun with the society as a whole. If you would like to sign up for an audition or simply would like to find out more about the society, please visit our website: https://www.union.ic.ac.uk/arts/acappella/ our facebook page: www.facebook.com/ICUACappella/ our Instagram: @icacappella or send us an email: acappella@imperial.ac.uk CSP Chair / President

societies.name: ABACUS
societies.description: We aim to bring together British and Chinese cultures with multiple events to cater for everyone - from hotpot and karaoke to ice skating and bowling. We plan exciting events throughout the year, such as celebrations for Chinese New Year, Christmas and so on! Being a part of the London ABACUS network allows us to host events at exclusive venues across the city alongside seven other universities. As a diverse society, our members range from BBCs (British Born Chinese) and any international students to anyone interested in Chinese culture. By joining ABACUS, you will also have access to discounts at an array of Chinese restaurants and cafés across London. So what are you waiting for? Join IC ABACUS today! For more information, check us out on Facebook (Imperial College ABACUS Facebook group) and Instagram (@ic_abacus). Send us a message on our Instagram to get signed up to our mailing list! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Acute Care Specialities
societies.description: We provide fantastic opportunities for students to gain insight into careers in the above-mentioned specialties through a variety of interactive and engaging events throughout the year, in collaboration with junior doctors and consultants. We are privileged to have the support of specialty experts who are passionate about improving understanding of careers in these exciting specialties. Popular events in the past year included practical skills workshops, specialty career talks, small group case-based tutorials, medical simulation sessions, a clinical skills mock OSCE and our annual national conference. Attending our events will help you to develop knowledge and skills useful for clinical practice, in addition to aiding exam preparation. If you are interested and want to learn more, please join our mailing list for information alerts about upcoming events: http://bit.do/ICAIC-newsletter Purchase annual membership for just £3. Membership gives you priority access and discounted entry to many of our events throughout the year! “Like” our Facebook page here: https://www.facebook.com/ICAnaesthetics?fref=ts “Follow” us on Twitter here: https://twitter.com/ImperialCAIC CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Aeronautics
societies.description: AeroSoc is a community where aeronautics students and aerospace enthusiasts get together to enjoy eye-opening and fun events. As a member throughout the year, you'll get to participate in weekly career talks accompanied by some of the most reputable companies, and you'll have an opportunity to expand your relations with possible future employers. Last year, some of our guests were from Lockheed Martin, Aston Martin, Airbus, Rolls-Royce, Alpine Formula 1, British Airways, and Cathay Pacific... So don't forget to become a member and receive our weekly newsletter to stay up to date! Every year, we make sure that newcomers feel as welcomed as possible; thus, when you start the academic year, you'll be assigned aero parents who will follow you throughout the year as a part of the 'Mums & Dads program', providing you with guidance and support. This year, we'll be bringing the Alumni Mentors program so that our students can stay in contact with the graduating class, receive their recommendations, and benefit from their experience. Apart from our brilliant academically helpful plans, we’ll also have amazing socials to connect with each other closely like end-of-year boat party, Christmas dinner, and more... Remember to check out our Instagram page to get to know our society better! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Algorithmic Trading
societies.description: Our mission is simple: we want to teach our members about the world of trading, whether that be quantitative, algorithmic or the basics of financial markets. No matter if you are a first-year fresher, a final-year student or a post-grad, we host a variety of events and programmes to help you develop an interest in the area of markets and trading! We run events every week during term time, whether that may be our annual London inter-uni hackathon "Algothon", here on campus or a speaker from one of our sponsor firms! If you don't know the first thing about markets, you're in the right place! We run an 8-week AlgoCourse to train you on all the basics you need for a career in markets, done by fellow Imperial markets interns. To apply your understanding and get real-life experience, join us at our student-managed fund, Queen's Tower Capital, where you can give it your best shot at creating trading strategies! We have a new society this year: Imperial College Women in Trading society, introducing STEM-focused women to the fast-moving world of markets by bridging the gap between hard-science classrooms and live trading floors. Find more on our website and follow us on social media: We look forward to meeting you on-campus! Feel free to contact us: algo.trade@imperial.ac.uk CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Alternative Music
societies.description: What is alternative music? Anything. The weird and obscure, the danceable, the frankly unlistenable, Dutch glitch-core hip-hop, Japanese post-hardcore math-rock or occasionally indiepop, all musical genres are welcome here. This society is a group for music lovers, those who want to discover interesting and new music, and meet other people who are also fanatically obsessed with discovering new bands. Our members possess a huge wealth of knowledge about the London music scene, the latest upcoming bands and the venues to see them, and the side street record stores nobody knows about. Along with our weekly meets in the union, the society also hosts subsidised events for members throughout the year. In the past few years, some of the bands we’ve seen include: Tame Impala, Bon Iver, Alvvays, Michael Kiwanuka, Franz Ferdinand, Four Tet, James Blake, Wild Beasts, Mac DeMarco, Bloc Party, The Vaccines, SOPHIE, Animal Collective, Foals, Flume, Fat White Family, and many many more. We meet weekly to share new music, run record store pub crawls, host a radio show on ICRadio, and regularly produce content for the Felix Music section. See our social media pages or drop us an email if you want to get involved! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: American Football
societies.description: The Immortals are a fierce and competitive American football team, proudly representing Imperial College London. As the 2022 Southeast Division 1 Champions and 2024 Southern Conference Cup Semi-Finalists, we are committed to building on our last years season and going undefeated this year. We welcoming players of all experience levels - even if you have never touched an American Football, we want you to join, many of our players were in your position when they joined! We play in a mixed league and strongly encourage women to join us. Build your mental and physical strength to keep fit during your degree with one of the best communities at Imperial. Instagram: @ImmortalsAFCTikTok @ImmortalsAFCRookie Groupchat: https://chat.whatsapp.com/E6wbWXBVJEQB8TgwkBe1IF CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: AnimeSoc
societies.description: Come learn how to draw manga, play games or just hang out at our weekly Wednesday sessions. Membership will give you access to the ICAS library, boasting over 500 items, as well as discounted entry to our events and band concerts. We also collaborate with other London universities, such as LSE, KCL, and UCL, where we host special inter-university events. We also have Melon Band, our very own in-house band, who perform popular anisong & J-pop/Rock songs at various concerts throughout the school year. So come join us to enjoy your favourite OPs and EDs, or showcase your glowstick and call skills! For those who prefer the digital world more, our Discord server is the perfect place to connect with the diverse and wonderful ICAS community. Explore our Instagram page and website for more information. We hope to see you soon, both in person and online, and share love for J-culture. https://discord.gg/BgwDD69 Sign up to our mailing list for weekly forecasts: https://mailman.ic.ac.uk/mailman/listinfo/animesoc-list. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Arabic
societies.description: You can look forward to Arabic lessons, dinners, games nights, talks and extensive collaborations with other London Universities. Imperial College Arabic Society welcomes anyone with an avid interest in the Arab world to both participate and constructively contribute to the society whilst upholding the stance of the Arabic Society as an essential community within the university. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Archery
societies.description: We have a dedicated course for beginners with all equipment and coaching provided. We are always on the lookout for experienced archers to supplement our senior team. The club has an excellent competitive record at South East England Universities Archery League and national BUCS events, and provides numerous opportunities for archers to compete at their own level throughout the year. On top of that, the club hosts sessions on archery equipment and biomechanics, and is socially active with a variety of events organised throughout the year. If you are interested in trying archery, please come along to our free have-a-go session in the first weeks of term. We are a community of archers, from social to competitive, traditional to recurve. Come and experience the way of the bow and arrow! Please visit https://imperialarchery.notion.site/Imperial-College-Archery-Club-2025-Information-e78ca7f891824a659d24d90cc7ed918a#aa0d644c27d54e1090ac20e768e15fa2 for more information and taster session sign ups! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Argentine Tango
societies.description: Beyond lessons, we also collaborate with UCL's tango society for joint events, so there are plenty of chances to meet people outside of Imperial. While we don't compete, every year we organise a choreographed performance for an end-of-year ball. This is optional, but if you're interesting in taking part, even complete beginners can perform if they attend our sessions regularly. Come join us for the good vibes and laughsFeel free to DM us on instagram @argentine_tango_icl, or send us an email at argtango@ic.ac.uk if you have any questions :) CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Artsoc
societies.description: ArtSoc aims to encourage the Arts within Imperial College by finding the best student and group discount rates to the best performances in the world-famous West End. We also organise socials and day trips to festivals :) You'll make back your £5 membership fee and more by going to just one musical through us! Here at ArtSoc, we aim to let you enjoy West End productions without your finances going south. We hope to hold our annual ArtSoc International Tour in Spring which promises to be affordable for students on a tight budget without missing out on all the best attractions that the cities have to offer. Plays, musicals, comedy performances, concerts and other cultural events - Join our society to enjoy the spectacular arts scene in London with like-minded individuals! If the tickets for the musical you want to go for are sold out, feel free to contact us! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Australian
societies.description: We hold regular relaxed social events, including celebration of Australian Holidays and sports matches to casual BBQs. From brunch to fairy bread, vegemite to a proper coffee, we're perfect for anyone who's up for meeting new people and chilling over good food, in true Aussie fashion. So whether you're looking for a home away from home or just want to learn about a nation that has so much more to offer than holiday destinations, come join us at AusSoc. We're a friendly group of people who are welcoming to all! Aussie Aussie Aussie! P.S. Watch out for those drop bears CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Badminton
societies.description: If you think you're good enough for the competitive team, make sure you come to our trials - we have 2 mens’, 1 mixed and 1 womens’. In addition, we have a mixed Social team that is open to everyone, with no trials or skill level limits. Joining this team gives players the opportunity to participate in competitive matches to gain experience! We also offer coaching sessions every Friday, where a member of the competitive team can help you to sharpen your badminton skills. Interested already? Join us for a year of fun that extends beyond playing badminton to our social events such as dinners, karaoke, ice skating and more! You can find us on Facebook at ‘’Imperial College Badminton Club’’ and Instagram at @ICBadminton. For more information, visit our website union.ic.ac.uk/acc/badminton/ or email us with any queries on badminton@imperial.ac.uk. Hope to see you soon! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Badminton (ICSM)
societies.description: For team members, we host training twice a week and weekly games run by our fabulous team captains! Our social players enjoy the incredible atmosphere in our regular friendly sessions, and you won't believe how much you'll improve throughout the year. We are always looking for new players, so make sure you come to our give-it-a-go sessions at the start of term and show up at our team trials! Badminton aside, the club also hosts many social events. Enjoy lively sports nights, bowling, our international tour (where could we be this year?), NAMs tournament and dinners throughout the year. For loads of fun on and off court come join us today! Come along to our weekly social sessions, check out our stall at fresher’s fair or visit our Instagram: @icsmbadminton Feel free to contact our President (Zach) at zzc22@ic.ac.uk! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Badminton (RSM)
societies.description: We compete in the bottle match and have an excellent record, so we are always on the lookout for top talent! If you want to get involved with the RSM, badminton is a great place to start! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Baking
societies.description: Welcome to Baking Society, where the aroma of freshly baked goods fills the air and you are our secret ingredient! Whether you're a seasoned pro or a beginner eager to explore the world of baking, there's something for every baker here! From sharing recipes or following GBBO to hands-on workshops and friendly bake-offs, we've got a tasty mix of activities! Getting involved is as easy as pie, simply join us to become a member today! Look out for our emails or follow us on Instagram for the latest updates on our upcoming events and activities! Let's whip up delightful memories together in a world of sweet and savoury creations, one recipe at a time! ⋆°∘🍩.˚₊‧☆🥐┈┈ ˗ˏˋ꒰.˚₊‧*🥣*‧₊˚.꒱ˎˊ˗ ┈┈🍰☆‧₊˚.🥧∘°⋆ CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Bangladeshi
societies.description: Starting university can be a daunting experience. We’re here to alleviate that pressure by helping you connect with new people and get involved with some great events and initiatives. We’ve got tonnes of events lined up, including lighthearted games nights and cultural events to get in touch with Bangladeshi heritage. Look out for Maa month in February where we dedicate a month’s worth of events to raising money for the Maternal Aid Association. This money will help mothers in rural and developing areas of Bangladesh and Afghanistan. Our fan favourite wing crawl is sure to get your attention and it gets better and better each year. This year we will also be implementing Bangla language lessons. This could be a fun way to reconnect with your mother tongue, or a chance to learn a new language entirely. Come give it a shot to see if you could be the next big Bangla poet. And there’s so much more! We are a cultural society focused on helping our members throughout uni, and making their experience unforgettable. We look forward to seeing you at our events! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Barbell
societies.description: For anyone wishing to compete, we have an amazing community with amazing world class coaches. We have dedicated powerlifting and weightlifting teams that we have taken to compete at national and international levels and have also nurtured international champions! We accept athletes at all levels of their strength journey. If you're a newbie, you will be guided through technique by our coaches. If you're experienced, our memberships support your training and competition entry, allowing you to excel. We have an amazing, motivating community that pushes you to grow and get stronger! We can't wait for you to join us. Make sure to follow us on Instagram @icbarbell and join our Whatsapp group below! If you have any questions or would like more info on our sessions, please see our FAQ page: https://imperiallondon-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/g/personal/barbell_ic_ac_uk/EVlKRDhCyoBEudOIz_vJUX8BRr7qeEtkj1Jor1Cpuxzb7g?e=KUfpZs CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Baseball and Softball
societies.description: Whether you’ve played before or maybe seen it on Wii Sports or in movies like Moneyball, come give it a go! Our club is truly open to players of all abilities and we have the equipment to get you started (gloves, bats, helmets etc). Practice sessions are every Wednesday at Hyde Park ?, with sessions on Saturday for friendly games, trips to batting cages and scrimmages at our Harlington pitch or Finsbury Park. Twice a month, we go to BUCS games and tournaments ?⚾️ up and down the South-Eastern Tier, from our Harlington pitch to Surrey Sports Park, Kent's Parkwood Pitches and Oxford Horspath Ground. We guarantee there will be chances for all to play in competitive games throughout the year. We are very proud of being two-time BUBA Southern Division and Fall Cup Baseball Champions, and two-time LUSL Softball Champions. This year we're gunning to qualify as usual for BUCS Softball Nationals and target a top 3 finish in the National Baseball University Championships. We are a social club; you can look forward to a 3-legged bar crawl, bowling ?, nights out at Slug with other clubs, Brick Lane curries ?, mini golf ⛳️ and more. You can always expect a trip to Union post-training for some chill banter . You’ll definitely make friends here, so what are you waiting for? Come join us! Bi-weekly training by Albert Memorial/Hyde Park on Wednesdays 1:30pm and Saturdays 11am! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Basketball
societies.description: The Basketball society has also been very successful over the last few years, with Women’s 1st team being first of the league many years in a row, then Men's 3 being first this 2024 in BUCS 4!! Les Parisiennes Sciences Po tournament on tour to Paris was a success!!  We are also Imperial's Sports Club of the Year in 2019 and trying as well this 2024 (we have been nominated!!) And if that’s not enough, we have lots of basketball events throughout the year! There's the end of term charity tournaments, a team Thanksgiving meal, Christmas dinner or most importantly – the annual International tour; we have plenty of events to keep you away from the library. So people, if you love basketball, follow our social media accounts, keep an eye out for our events and come join us! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.description: Midweek Service: Wednesday @ 6.30pm at Room 640, City and Guilds Building, South Kensington Campus Sunday Service: Sunday @ 12pm at Kings Church, Harris Lecture Theatre, Hodgkin Building, Guys Campus SE1 1UL Join our whatsapp group chat here!! https://chat.whatsapp.com/LNBwi8IIalOG62VoIzgmXT Link to our Give it a Go: Campus Kickoff -https://www.imperialcollegeunion.org/whats-on/event/11820 CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Benelux Society
societies.description: Whether you are from the Benelux or simply interested in our culture, we welcome any member to join us in the great adventure that comes with being a member of ICBenelux. Expect Pub Crawls, Dinners, cross university meetups, BNL food and drinks (waffles, beers, poffertjes, chocolate, ... ), and many more! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Big Band
societies.description: IC Big Band, made up of scientists, engineers, and medics at Imperial, all with a passion for jazz, is a driving force in the university big band scene within London and the UK. The first-call band for events both in and out of the College, IC Big Band has garnered an exceptional reputation over the years, including national recognition on winning the platinum award at the National Concert Band Festival in 2017. We are a fully auditioned big band, with openings for saxophones, trumpets, trombones, rhythm, and vocalists. With an ever-expanding library with hundreds of charts, the band regularly perform sets ranging from the swing hits of Basie to the funk and fusion of Pat Metheny, and of course the classics of Miller-Ellington! We are directed by Chris Dean (leader of Syd Lawrence Orchestra), a giant in the UK big band scene, and have enjoyed plentiful gig opportunities under his direction, such as our sold-out annual gig at PizzaExpress Jazz Club (Soho) and our collaboration concert with the Syd Lawrence Orchestra in Spring 2022! As well as our outings at well-known venues in and around the capital, we also form an integral part of the Union entertainment calendar, with hugely popular termly gigs at Metric, appearances at Arts’ Nights, and our annual performances at the Summer Ball! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Bio Engineering
societies.description: We host numerous events throughout the year, including social, wellbeing, industrial, and academic focused events. Some examples include pub crawls, Christmas meals, Therapy Dog Sessions, arts and crafts, HealthHack, and Quiz nights. These provide an atmosphere where you can meet students from other years and get involved within the department in a fun environment. Other events such as Careers Fairs and panels mean you can have an intimate opportunity to meet with potential future employers, and possibly obtain jobs or internship offers for those companies particularly seeking bioengineering students. Internship 101, Year in Industry and UROP 101 talks give insight on how other students have gotten great opportunities in the past. There are also plenty of other ways to get involved with the society, including organised day trips out, and sports tournaments. We aim to provide a friendly place for students to chill as well as well-deserved opportunities for hardworking bioengineers to take a break from their books. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Biochemistry
societies.description: What can you expect? A little bit of everything. We organize a diverse range of events, from academic seminars and career talks to an array of fun social activities. Last year, we launched the Biochem/BioSoc Boat Party, and we’re excited to bring it back—bigger and better. Other beloved events like Winter Wonderland, Kew Gardens, pub crawls, and ice skating will continue, along with many new ones. This year, we're also expanding our network, with exciting collaborations in the works with Biochemistry/Biotechnology societies at Oxford, UCL, and Kings. If large events aren't your thing —we’ve got plenty of smaller gatherings like bake-offs, art events, and more. As a departmental society, we’re not just here to ensure you have a fun time; we’re also committed to working with the department to enhance your academic experience. Our academic talks connect you with leading researchers, and because we know there’s more to life than science, career support services are here to help  explore different paths and navigate application processes. BiochemSoc is run by students, for students. We welcome suggestions for new events and improvements to the course. 2.	Enhanced career support 3.	Strengthening our student community 4.	More collaborations with other societies The 2024-25 committee is excited to make this another amazing year! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Biology
societies.description: 🌱 Welcome to the Biology Society! 🧬 Whether you're a passionate biologist, or just looking for a place to unwind and meet new people, we have something for everyone. If you love sports, join us for dodgeball or come along for some indoor bouldering with friends🧗‍♀️. Prefer to relax after complex BCM mechanisms? Join us for our trip to the theatre, games nights, or our exciting visit to the iconic Kew Gardens 🌺 with exclusive tours led by staff! And don’t miss our legendary collabs – from the annual pub quizzes 🍻 to the end-of-year boat party with BiochemSoc 🚤, there’s always something going on! On the academic side, we offer career panels 💼, expert talks, conferences and skills workshops, designed to help you carve your path in Life Sciences. And here’s the best part: If you're a Biological Sciences student, you're automatically a member! If not, you're still more than welcome to join us! Simply join the society below and to stay updated on all our exciting events, make sure to follow us on Instagram @icbiosoc and Linkedin https://www.linkedin.com/company/ic-biosoc. Check out our website https://biosoc.fly.dev where you can meet our committee and see upcoming events that we have planned for you guys! You can join the 2025-2026 Biological Sciences chat in our Instagram linktree to start connecting with your cohort now! Feel free to reach out anytime – we’re here to support, inspire, and grow together! With love from your 2025-26 BioSoc Committee 💚🧬 CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Bioscience Review
societies.description: Want to meet established science journalists, and to see your own articles published online and on print? As a student-led initiative, we provide a platform for students of all stages and backgrounds to freely explore the most emergent themes of the life sciences. Our articles and magazine issues are also free to access – an aspect that we hope diminishes the barrier to science. Established in August 2020, we have since grown our base to over 120 yearly writers and published over 500 articles. If you join our enthusiastic group of writers, you will benefit from editorial feedback, improving your writing and research skills. Watch out for the various opportunities to present your work and attend guest speaker events throughout the year! We also intend to collaborate with other Imperial societies and top UK universities in affordable networking events. If any of this appeals to you, make sure to become a member and follow us on our social media pages below: [https://linktr.ee/imperialbiosciencereview] CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Blockchain
societies.description: Welcome to the Imperial Blockchain & FinTech Society (IBF)—Imperial College London’s leading community for blockchain innovation, fintech education, and professional development. Whether you’re passionate about technology, investment, or research, IBF offers an unparalleled platform to learn, grow, and connect with peers and industry leaders. Sign up and follow our socials to stay updated. Visit our website to apply for ImperialDAO and other positions. CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Boat
societies.description: We offer world class coaching and facilities for our joint men’s and women’s team who train together on the river in Putney, just a 20 minute cycle from college or easily accessible on public transport. Our novice and senior squads have regular success at major rowing events including BUCS, the Heads of the River, Henley Women’s and Henley Royal Regatta. We are lucky to have a state-of-the-art gym and clubroom on site alongside a well-maintained fleet of boats. With stunning views onto the Thames, it is the perfect place to train and socialise. Our social calendar ranges from classic pub trips and brunches to water fights, scavenger hunts and black tie dinners. We also train and compete abroad, with trips to Croatia, Spain and Poland in 2023. As one of Imperial’s most successful and sociable clubs, we offer the perfect opportunity to develop yourself both as an individual and as part of a team. University is a great place to try a new sport, so if you want to be part of a fun, supportive and friendly team, why not give us a try? Check out our website and social media channels, or get in touch with our captains for this season: josh.bateman21@imperial.ac.uk (men's captain) and orla.johnson22@imperial.ac.uk (women's captain) CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Boat (ICSM)
societies.description: Looking to try something new at Imperial within an incredibly relaxed, social and supportive atmosphere? Look no further than ICSM Boat Club! As the largest mixed sports team at ICSM with over 100 male and female members, our main aim is to live up to the ethos of work hard and play hard! Doesn't matter if you've never even been near a boat before - you will be mentored by a dedicated captain to make your fresher year fantastic on and off the water. Rowed before? Then you will move into one of our senior squads who compete against the other London Medical Schools as well as in international competitions such as Head of the River and Henley Royal Regatta. We always welcome new faces! Outings are Wednesdays and Saturday/Sundays in addition to amazing squad socials and renowned educational support. ICSMBC have the largest circles every Wednesday at the famed sports nights and hold a huge annual international tour to Leuven, Belgium. CSP Chair / President Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Book
societies.description: Your source of everything book-related at Imperial. Throughout the year we have all sorts of events, from bookshop crawls to theatre trips to wine & cheese book swaps. We get together monthly to discuss a book chosen by the members (and heavily subsidised!), over biscuits and occasionally over pints at the union later. It doesn’t matter what you like to read, or how much reading you do (always hard to fit the time in); the club is a wonderful environment to meet lovely people and perhaps to ensure you take a little time to read through a book. We are excited to welcome new members into our growing club and to enjoy some literary experiences together! Join our WhatsApp group and Mailing list, and follow us on Instagram @icbookclub for details & announcements. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Botanical
societies.description: CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Boxing
societies.description: Welcome to IC Boxing Club! We’re an all-inclusive club and cater for all abilities from complete beginner to experienced boxers. If your aim is to get fit or represent the university and box competitively, we are the club for you. We hold training 6 days a week: we run sessions in the Union building as well as in external gyms in South Kensington, Battersea and Lambeth where you can hone your technique and become better boxers. Whether you come to get fit or fight, our sessions will get you strong and build your endurance. Many of our Imperial boxers have never boxed before, so fret not if you’re a complete beginner. Regardless of what level you're at, we promise to provide you with the following: improved self-discipline, greater self-confidence, enhanced boxing skills and an unparalleled level of fitness. Throughout the year, IC Boxing enters boxers in shows and competitions and also runs events like barnights and trips to boxing events. Come along and see for yourself why boxing really is the sweet science! Sessions are priced at £4 (bookable below on the union shop) and each member will need to buy a £10 annual training pass for gym access. Join our WhatsApp/ mailing list for more info! https://linktr.ee/imperialcollegeboxing22?utm_source=linktree_profile_share<sid=b2cf1804-8a81-4a5f-b26b-69fed8635893 CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.description: No description available

societies.name: Bridge
societies.description: Our society is open to players of all levels, from beginners to seasoned competitors. We are lucky to have members from the national team who provide expert training and guidance. In the past, we have been ranked second among UK universities in the Portland Bowl . Whether you're looking to compete or simply enjoy the game socially, our society is the perfect place to get involved and have fun. We meet every Tuesday 6-8 p.m. for weekly events, including practice sessions, friendly games and competitions with other universities. You can leave early if you are not free for the session. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Buddhist
societies.description: Join us to Meditate and explore Buddhism! Buddhism is a path for anyone seeking a more content life free from stress and anxiety. Imperial College Buddhist Society (ICBS) serves as a foundation for anyone interested in Buddhism. Meditation is not just a religious practice and you do not need to consider yourself a Buddhist to attend our events. The activities we hold this year include Meditation, Dharma talks and socials on weekly and monthly basis at the IC Chaplaincy at 15 Prince's Gardens. If you are interested in any of these, please click the sign up button and become a member of ICBS for free. We can together enjoy the peace, calm and stress relief of meditation. Join us on Instagram at:https://instagram.com/icbuddhistsociety And whatsapp at:https://chat.whatsapp.com/CP4zR3AoK1RHbucmeW8Z1K Drop us an email to find out more! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Canadian Society
societies.description: Missing a cup of good old timmies double-double with timbits? Did someone say poutine? Wanna find out where to get good maple syrup? Eager to bash the U.S on their current political circus? Then join us at the Canadian Society! We aim to provide a chill place to just hang out with fellow Canadians, Half-Canadians, or anyone who is generally interested in Canadian culture! Throughout the year we will organise a plethora of fun events to celebrate things that we all miss from home, including thanksgiving celebrations (the correct one), Hockey nights and ice skating. We also plan on bringing you a careers talk with various Canadian companies present in London later in the year, inviting big names like Bombardier and RBC. Renowned for our politeness, we will welcome with open arms anyone who would desire a taste of “the true North”, and of course, if you are Canadian and are feeling homesick, here is the best place to cure it! CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Canoe
societies.description: Open to complete beginners and pros alike we travel the UK and further afield to find the best white-water with great company Whether you’re a complete beginner or a gnarly V+ river runner, joining the Canoe Club is a great way to add to your Imperial experience! We run regular white-water weekend trips around the most picturesque parts of England and Wales, including Snowdonia, the Lake District, and Devon. These trips are a great way to get out of London and have loads of fun. We also head further afield a few times a year to the likes of Scotland, the Alps, and Norway catering to differing skill levels so everyone has a chance to experience foreign white-water (Summer Tour is an ICCC classic). Some of our more skilled members have ventured on expeditions as far as Georgia, India, and Vietnam with their kayaks! The best way to see what ICCC has to offer is at our weekly pool sessions on Tuesday evenings at Ethos. You can get to grips with the basics or improve your freestyle tricks, then finish off with a few games of canoe polo. We then head to the Union for a pint or two after. We also hold regular socials/sports nights to get to know the other paddlers off the river! Whether drinking or non-drinking socials are your thing there's something for everyone. We look forward to seeing you on the water soon! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Cardiovascular
societies.description: CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Catholic
societies.description: Welcome to the Imperial Catholic Society page! We are a friendly group of Catholic Christians who meet regularly on Wednesdays for two of the greatest things in the entire universe: Mass, and free lunch. We also get together on the 2nd Saturday of the month for a Vigil Mass and some time together affectionately referred to as 'MOPS' - Mass, fOod, Prayer and Social. Wherever you find yourself in relation to this man from Galilee called Jesus, we would love you to join us! Who is He? Why be Catholic and not just Christian? How can I get to know other believers on campus? Come along to some of our Give it a Go events and see. Details are all on our socials. Our faith is a wonderfully rich treasure of wisdom and joy and practical action. We know that Jesus and His Church have been changing the world since 33AD and we can't wait for all that He has in store for us in London this coming year. Come and join us! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Caving
societies.description: CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Chamber Choir
societies.description: We perform up to two concerts per term and sing fortnightly Wednesday evensongs at Holy Trinity Church, Prince Consort Road. We regularly undertake various external projects such as recently recording a BBC radio 3 evensong, joint concerts with other established choirs, various cathedral evensongs such as Southwark and much more! Taking our music outside of college is very important to us, and we go on a weekend away, 5 day Easter tour and a week-long summer tour throughout the year. Our summer tours are a highlight of the year, both musically and socially. Recent tours have included: Porto, Portugal (2017), Ljubljana, Slovenia (2018), Krakow, Poland (2019), Tuscany, Italy (2022) and Galicia, Spain (2023), Estonia and Finland (2024) singing high-calibre choral music in and around their most famous venues. We are currently preparing to record a new CD in June centred around the theme of "Home" with Convivium Records! We welcome new members to our annual auditions that run in October. For any queries, please contact the Chair, Olivia Priestland, using the email address on the right-hand side of this page. Please check out our website to stay up to date with all of our upcoming events: https://icchamberchoir.org/ and our incredible socials @icchamberchoir CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Chamber Music
societies.description: Whether you're a seasoned performer, a 'retired' instrumentalist, an inexperienced player, or don't play an instrument; if you love music of any type, we have something to offer! Members can enjoy: 1) Forming and performing in your own ensembles (pianists are welcome!) 2) Joining competitions, workshops and masterclasses 3) Performing in concerts, formal and casual, solo and in an ensemble 4) Attending a broad range of concerts in and out of Imperial (subsidised by the society!) and 5) Gatherings with FOOD! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Cheerleading
societies.description: We also have super fun socials, including rollerskating, club nights, pub quizzes and TOUR! Many of our socials are with American Football too. We also have a linkedin page, so you can network with alumni! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Chemical Engineering
societies.description: Our aim is to provide all of our students with the best university experience by offering awesome social events, continuous wellbeing and academic support, and unparalleled access to industry throughout your time in the department. Members from other departments with an interest in ChemEng are welcome too! We organise social events throughout the year catering to all interests. Whether you want to go to laser tag with your friends, attend the long-running ChemEng Talent Show, or enjoy one of our new Wine & Cheese nights, you can always find something to do with ChemEngSoc! Finally, don’t forget the annual (FREE) Welcome Dinner for all new members. These are perfect opportunities to meet new people from the course and make lasting memories! As a member, you will have access to a huge range of careers and academic events to help you transfer into your dream career. Whether it’s chemicals or consulting (or something in between!) we’ve got it covered with uniquely tailored sessions. We offer workshops, mock interviews, networking sessions, and invitations to presentations from international experts – all completely free to members in all years. Our comprehensive alumni network is also available to help through our dedicated networking events. You can be confident that your interests drive everything we do as a Soc. We always want to hear from our members, so get in touch at chemengsoc@imperial.ac.uk if you’ve got feedback or ideas. See you at an event soon! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Chess
societies.description: Everyone can join our club. For those who want to get better at chess, we have experts happy to share their opinions on positions. For those who want to play some judgment-free blitz, we have clocks. If you think chess needs an update, we love variants and are open to suggestions; our current fancy is “ring-exchange”: four boards in a circle, when a piece is taken, it gets passed to the next board, it must be seen to be believed. Club runs every Monday at 18:30 in Blackett 539. Events (generally, all members can join a team because we make more if one fills up): Central London Chess Congress – FIDE-rated tournaments that we host twice a year (usually during November and April) with around 100 participants (discounted entry fee for all club members). London Chess League (LCL) – ECF-rated weekly matches, on weekday evenings against other teams from London. We have a team in Division 2, the highest of any university, and a team in the women's league. 2020Chess – Online blitz games against teams from around the world. Club Blitz Tournaments – A few times a year, we turn our club night into a tournament for members with snacks and prizes. Find our hottest news on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/chess_icl/ CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Chinese
societies.description: Being one of the largest Chinese societies in the UK, Imperial College Chinese Society aims to promote and integrate Chinese culture within the student community and to serve as the stepping stone for unifying all Chinese students studying abroad. This year, on top of the social events that we have organized in the past such as the Freshers' Dinner, Variety Show, inter-university sports events, and CNY celebrations, we also plan to organize investment banking talks and leadership workshops to enhance the job prospect of our members. Come join our family and meet lifelong friends! societies.name: Choir
societies.description: We are a choir of about 100 members, comprising students, staff and alumni. Our rehearsals are on Thursdays from 18:00-20:30, where we learn our termly repertoire with our wonderful conductor and accompanist. The pieces we sing, both long and short, range from old classics to more modern and contemporary pieces; there is something in it for everyone. Every year we hold several concerts, where we collaborate with orchestras, ensembles and soloists, performing in venues ranging from small Churches to the Royal Albert Hall for Imperial College’s yearly Commemoration events. Join us at choir pub after rehearsals, and come along to socials, which could be anything from ice-skating over Karaoke, or weekend trips to different cities and even trips abroad to perform concerts. If you simply enjoy singing, want to connect with people outside of your course or are looking for a break from your daily routine, come to Choir! We look forward to seeing you. For more information, check out our Linktree. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Christian Medical Fellowship
societies.description: Imperial's Christian Medical Fellowship is here to equip medical students to live and speak for Jesus. Whether you are a fresher or final year, grad-entry or intercalating, committed Christian or just curious about Christianity, everyone is welcome to join. Our aims are summarised by our name: Christian - We are here to support and encourage Christian medics in their faith and also to engage with those who are curious about faith. Medical - We provide a platform to discuss relevant ethical issues that we will face as well as educational support. Fellowship - We love to spend time together at regular prayer meets across various sites and socials, which provide amazing home-cooked meals and time to build lasting friendships. We are very excited to welcome freshers to our growing family with events such as a 'families' scheme, which will pair up freshers with older years who will offer support and guidance in issues of faith and in our studies. Other highlights of last year included the CU/CMF weekend away, the annual Christmas dinner and the national CMF students' conference. If you have any other questions, feel free to contact Dani at daniella.bae20@imperial.ac.uk CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Christian Union
societies.description: Our weekly events include a Bible study on Monday evening going through the life of Jesus, a gathering on Thursday evening equipping CU members to tell others about Jesus, and a lunchtime talk on Friday afternoon answering big questions about life and how they relate to Jesus. We also run plenty of extra events throughout the year. CU is not a substitute for a local church: we unite as students who attend different churches to make Christ known on our campus. We unite around our doctrinal basis, which can be found at http://www.uccf.org.uk/about/doctrinal-basis. You can always contact us if there's anything you want to ask! Our email: cu@imperial.ac.uk Our Instagram: imperial_cu Our website: http://iccu.co.uk/ CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Cinema
societies.description: Oh, you're also on a budget because student life in London is expensive? We have that covered too: our tickets are all under £5 per person per film (and you can get even better deals during our All-NighterTM (not an actual trademark please don't sue). We offer professional quality screenings with our 33ft screen and 7-channel Dolby Digital EX surround sound. We own both a as well as having a homebrew 3D system, isn't that cool? We think it's cool. If you also think it's cool and are interested in learning how all of these cool gadgets work, please don't hesitate to contact us to join our projectionists team (and watch films for free)! We are an independent cinema, that projects twice a week (with exceptional ). CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Civil Engineering
societies.description: We are one of the most active departmental societies in the college, organising a wide variety of events throughout the year to cater for the diverse needs and interests of our students. It is through these social activities that we have developed a very cohesive student body, in which students help their peers and support each other. The annual International Tour is the highlight of CivSoc's calendar and gives students the chance to explore contemporary and traditional engineering practice outside the UK as well as sampling the social and cultural delights of some of Europe's best loved cities. Destinations in recent years have included Madrid, Seville, Belgrade, Lisbon, Naples and Bucharest. Throughout the year, regular social events, pub-crawls and bar nights are complemented by the CivSoc Careers Fair, site visits and industry talks; the latter aided by our strong links with the civil engineering industry. The society's magazine, LIVIC, is published throughout the year. CivEng students are all automatically members of CivSoc, so check out our website and instagram, come to our amazing events and get involved! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Climate Entrepreneurs
societies.description: The Climate Entrepreneurs Club creates an ecosystem to inspire and enable entrepreneurial students to apply their skills by building ventures that address multiple layers linked to climate change, such as related UN SDGs. Throughout the year, we will be hosting events featuring CEOs and investors in the climate tech space, as well as workshops and networking events with like-minded students from other universities. Join us if you have an entrepreneurial mindset and want to build the network and skill set to have a real impact in the world! We welcome all levels of experience, from Climate Geeks to newcomers. CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Clinical Genetics
societies.description: CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Coding (ICSM)
societies.description: Everyone is welcome. No prior coding experience is needed! As a society, we aim to provide all student members easy access to free, beginner-level coding tutorials, in-person workshops, and events exploring the application of computing in medicine. We strive to foster a friendly environment for peer support, growth, and innovation. Medicine is exploding with new start-ups, technologies, and medical apps, making coding an indispensable skill for medics as medicine becomes more digitalised. From statistics to AI, ICSM Coding delivers. Join us to equip yourself with the skills for innovation! CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Composing & Songwriting
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Computational Biology
societies.description: Computational Biology is a student-led society for those interested in the intersection between biology and computer science. It is one of the first of its kind in the UK for an industry that is set to grow to billions of dollars. This society is for life and computer scientists alike to gain knowledge, that might be currently missing in their undergraduate studies, that they'll need to start a career in CompBio. We host regular seminars with top industry and academic figures to open your eyes to how CompBio is revolutionizing the life sciences. On top of that, we host coding classes tailored to the intricacies of working with biological data as well as workshops to use other tools in computational biology. Finally, every year we host our hallmark conference in the summer with several speakers from academia and industry. For the first time, we will potentially be hosting a hackathon this year. Both of these will be a great opportunity for networking. Can't miss them! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Consultancy
societies.description: Consulting is an up-and-coming industry aiming to provide innovative solutions to real-world problems, assist large companies around the globe to create value and fulfil their corporate mission. The Imperial College Consultancy Society (ICCS) is the leading student society that caters to everyone keen on consulting or wishing to pursue a career in consultancy. We have developed an extensive network with top tier consulting firms and provide platforms where our members can meet and network while learning from our sponsors. ICCS also runs a variety of training programs such as our in-house Case Study Club, as well as our Imperial Consulting Group (ICG) subsidiary, where you can gain genuine consulting experience. Moreover, this year we have joined the Global Research and Consulting (GRC) group alongside Harvard, The Wharton School, Cambridge, Oxford and other top universities. Obtain our free membership today to enjoy access to our exclusive opportunities and resources. Visit our website for more information and events:  https://iccsoc.com/ CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Cosmetic Sciences
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Cricket
societies.description: We cater for absolutely all abilities, so whether you've never touched a cricket bat before or you're the second coming of Don Bradman, there's a place for you here at ICUCC! Our setup includes 3 Men's XIs and a Women's XI, who all compete in BUCS (30-50 overs) and LUSL (T20) against other universities in London and the South of England. Meanwhile, our hugely popular Club XI plays Sunday friendlies against local clubs throughout the summer. We are the joint-highest ranked outdoor sport at Imperial, with both our Men's and Women's 1st XI competing in BUCS Division 1. Lords, the Home of Cricket, hosts our trials in October, with all four squads moving towards coached training in prestigious West London venues over Terms 1 and 2, before we switch to outdoor training in Term 3. Throughout the winter, we run an Indoor Cricket League for all members, while our Men's 1st XI compete in the BUCS Indoor National Championships. Last year, we reached the National Finals, making us one of the Top 8 teams in the country! We host a range of lively socials suited for both drinkers and non-drinkers, including annual dinners, the infamous Pub Cricket and many more. To top it all off, we run two tours a year (domestic and international) - the IC dominates abroad as well! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Cricket (ICSM)
societies.description: CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Cross Country & Athletics
societies.description: The club welcomes all members, from beginners to international athletes, and you'll quickly find friends and training partners amongst our huge membership. We run frequent trips away to races and tours throughout the year - including overseas! - and organise our own student relay race in Hyde Park with teams from around the country. If competition's your thing, we take teams to LUCA and BUCS competitions for cross country, indoors and outdoors. We also have social runs every Wednesday and breakfast runs every Sunday if that's your style. (check out our full schedule over on our Instagram). Please subscribe to the mailing list to be added to the weekly email. We post regularly on Instagram: @icrunning CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Cybersecurity
societies.description: CyberSoc: Imperial's Cybersecurity Society You're someone interested in the field of Cybersecurity.Regardless of whether you're interested in CTFs and competitive glory, the theoretical details and real-world application, or if you're in it for the industry insights and networking opportunities.No matter if you're a complete beginner, somewhat experienced, or a seasoned cybersecurity expert: you're welcome here :) Our community can be found on Discord.We mirror key information on our Whatsapp.Events are held either online or at South Ken Campus.Events are posted on Discord, Instagram and sent in our Newsletter.For the most up-to-date information, please check out our Website. societies.name: Cycling
societies.description: Imperial’s official cycling club—weekly road and MTB rides, BUCS racing, bike park trips, and more. The only London uni club with proper mountain biking. Open to all levels. Join London’s premier university cycling club!We cater to all kinds of riders—road cyclists, mountain bikers, and track racers alike.Our weekly Wednesday Richmond Park laps are the heart of the club—easy to join, all levels welcome, and a great way to meet people. On Sundays, we head out for longer road rides into the countryside, perfect for building fitness and exploring new routes.We also run a summer tour each year to places like the French Alps or Girona for a week of riding, climbing, sunshine, and good food.We’re the only university club in London with a proper MTB scene. Every Saturday, we ride trails in the Surrey Hills or Swinley Forest, with regular trips to bike parks like Rogate and weekenders to Wales—think Dyfi, Bike park Wales, and more. We also race BUCS Downhill.Whether you're just getting into cycling or chasing podiums, there’s something for you. We enter BUCS road, TT, hill climb, track and MTB events, and support riders of all levels.So whether you’re into training, racing, mountain biking, or just riding for fun, come get involved—we ride all year, and we’re a genuinely friendly club. CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Dance (ICSM)
societies.description: This year we have classes in Contemporary, Ballet, Heels and Commercial Jazz! Classes are taught in a relaxed environment to help you build up confidence, develop technique and keep fit. We perform at a number of exciting events throughout the year varying from shows to competitions! Aside from this, we have plenty of socials too including theatre visits, game nights, bar nights, sports nights, brunches and, of course, our annual tour! We also have an Academic Officer on hand to provide Medics and Biomeds with academic support. Come visit us at freshers fair! If you can't wait that long and want to know more get in contact with us on social media (instagram - @icsmdance, twitter - @icsm_dance) or send us an email! Sign up to our mailing list here: https://imperial.us5.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=8a8591bc6ae4ab9201aef6d6c&id=ff651bd79d CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Dance - Funkology
societies.description: Funkology is a street dance society at Imperial. Established in 2003, we experiment with different dance styles and strive to create a safe space for anyone who is interested in dancing, to enjoy the fun of dance and meet new friends.Our weekly classes, happening on Tuesday, are taught by professional dancers/choreographers which are experts in different styles. We offer classes of different levels and styles - you will find a classes suitable for you even if you haven't danced before!We also have two competition dance crews (Intermediate & Advanced) that actively perform at many events and compete at university competitions. Our advanced Crew has a great track record, winning 1st in the GHGH advanced street and choreography category, as well as performing on the big stage MOVE IT! Interested members can attend our auditions to get a chance to represent Funkology!If you want to learn from scratch, improve your skills or just try it out, come along to any of our classes! Looking forward to welcoming everyone to our big Funk family! Check us out and follow us on YouTube(FuNkoLoGy Dance Company), Instagram (ICUFuNkoLoGy) and Facebook (/FunkologyCrew)! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Dance Club
societies.description: With dancing being one of the best ways of staying active, IC Dance Club offers Ballroom (Waltz, Tango, Viennese Waltz, Foxtrot, Quickstep), Latin (Cha Cha, Samba, Rumba, Paso Doble, Jive), Salsa, and Bachata classes and socials fostered in a passionate environment with club spirit at its heart. With over 250 members, we offer classes for all skill levels, so whether you’re a complete beginner or think you’re at the top of your game, we have something for you 😁 Join the Ballroom & Latin Team and dance alongside the winners of the Inter Varsity Dance Championships 2023 Team Match 🏆 Taught by world-class coaches, unleash your inner dancer and burn the floor at a variety of university competitions ✨ Into something more social? Join the UK’s top student Salsa & Bachata Team! Take part in weekly socials and join an ever-expanding community as you attend global festivals 🌎, boat parties 🛥, and picnics 🌳 If you want to go above and beyond (literally, it’s flipping awesome), join the Open Level Team and learn phenomenal choreography to compete in university showcases 💃 No partner? No experience? No sweat! You bring the good vibes, and we’ll bring all the glitz and glamour you could dream of 🤩 CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Dance Company
societies.description: As well as this, we hold auditions for both intermediate and advanced teams for each style. These teams compete at various competitions across the UK, representing not just the society, but Imperial as well. Last year we attended University of Southampton and University of Manchester competitions, obtaining numerous awards across all disciplines. We also have other performance opportunities for all society members, not just those in teams, including the Christmas showcase, Dance Imperial show, and multiple charity events. We hold a variety of socials throughout the year including pizza and Kahoot nights, internal showcases and nights out! For more information email us at dcompany@ic.ac.uk and if you want to check out some of our performances you can find them at: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCShAmuMh-1XoRslt_mddxFg CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Data Science
societies.description: With a student reach across all major departments, the Imperial College Data Science Society (ICDSS) promotes data science awareness amongst the student body. The combination of data science and big data has been shifting the paradigm of many fields including but not limited to drug discovery, investment, and business strategy. ICDSS’s goal is to equip all interested students with key data science skills and bridge the gap between industry and academia. We do this by providing students with industry insights, skill development workshops, hackathons, and projects to practice the art of data science. The talents we develop help meet the high demands of various industries for data scientists. Look out for us on social media; we're active on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn and you can also find out more on our website: www.imperialdatasoc.co.uk. You can reach us via email at icdss@ic.ac.uk CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Debating
societies.description: If you're interested in debating even the slightest, pop on over to one of our free weekly sessions, held on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 18:30 in the Sir Alexander Fleming Building (Room 120). We hope to see you there! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Dermatology (ICSM)
societies.description: Dermatology society is the perfect society for you if you want to learn more about what it means to be a Dermatologist. It is also a great society if you are unsure on what to specialise in in the future and want to explore. Through our events, you will gain opportunities to network and connect with others interested or in the field of Dermatology. We have a variety of events running every year including: - Academic tutorials on Dermatology for exams - Career talks on the Dermatology specialty pathway - A pan-London DermSoc conference (SkinSynergy) which include workshops such as suturing skills We welcome all students to join us this year to learn more about Dermatology - we hope to see you at our events! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Design Engineering
societies.description: The world is changing, we need engineers who put people first, are able to think creatively to solve the challenges of our time and can make the most of the amazing opportunities for innovation. We believe that Design Engineering is the fusion of design thinking, engineering knowledge and practice within a culture of innovation and enterprise. We are the Design Engineering Society, the departmental society for the Dyson School of Design Engineering. We run a series of events throughout the year the build community within the school and inspire our members to be world leading in everything they do. Working closely with our industry partners we run an annual Makeathon, talks, and workshops. In addition to this we seek to provide Imperial’s Design Engineers with the best all round experience of studying in London with a series of socials and cultural activities throughout the year. All Imperial Design Engineers have the opportunity to become lifelong members as Alumni, to continue to get access to our great series of events and build friendships that will last a lifetime. Our vision is a movement that has a transformational impact on our society through the power of Design Engineering. We won Club, Society & Project of the year in 2019 - and we’re just getting started. CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Developer Student Club
societies.description: Over the first chapter in 2022, our community has grown to over 400 members, reinforcing our commitment to expanding tech literacy. Our extensive pipeline of events include: •	Workshops: Designed to impart hands-on tech skills and learn as a community. •	DSC AI Summit: An arena for data enthusiasts to wrangle with real-world challenges. •	Guest Sessions: Invitations to industry professionals who bring with them a wealth of experience and pioneering insights. •	GDG Academy Mentorship Program: Building bridges between students and seasoned leaders, focusing on career guidance and professional development. Furthermore, DSC provides substantial networking avenues, fostering connection and collaboration between students and professionals from a myriad of technological disciplines. We strive to continuously organise enriching initiatives and propel the growth of our community. Our mission is to move the needle at Imperial with a project-based, industry-led approach to enable students from all backgrounds to actualise their interest in Software Engineering. Our vision is to establish an inclusive community of innovators and life-long learners that partners with companies, non-profits, and organisations in pursuit of social good. Join us: Participate in a series of exciting events, workshops, and ideathons that will help you advance in the tech industry and extend your professional network. DSC sincerely welcomes students regardless of academic background. CSP Chair / President

societies.name: DJ & Production
societies.description: What we have to offer: Join the whatsapp community: https://chat.whatsapp.com/FZpyL9eTfSxEjOjBahr5B4 CSP Chair / President

societies.name: DoCSoc
societies.description: To keep you on your toes, we run tons of tech talks from the likes of Meta, Bloomberg, Google, Palantir, and more. In the past we’ve hosted talks and workshops centred around machine learning, blockchain technology and sentiment analysis, to name a few examples. We also host workshops centred around learning particular technologies such as Docker or React Native. Or join us at our annual flagship hackathon, IC Hack, where the best innovators from Imperial and beyond gather to build some extremely cool tech, all in 24 hours. If free sponsor merch, food from the likes Nando's, Dominos, and more, or random karaoke sessions are not enough, we don't know what is! It's not all about ones and zeroes though. We organise a whole bunch of social events from  theatre trips, ice skating, trampolining and more, all subsidised by a HUGE amount. We also host our own yearly club night, Revel, along with our traditional black-tie End Of Year Dinner. And who could forget our legendary bar nights at the Union? DoCSoc is run by DoC students, for DoC students (and for anyone interested in computing!), all to make your time at Imperial as enjoyable and rewarding as we can. Get involved! To get in touch, please send an email to docsoc@imperial.ac.uk. CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Doctorpreneurs
societies.description: We bring together like minded individuals and facilitate networking opportunities with those successful, passionate and well-connected in the field through our social evenings and annual conference. Join our mailing list today to find out more. CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Dodgeball
societies.description: You may have seen the film, or played it in PE, but Dodgeball is one of the country’s fastest-growing sports, and Imperial Dodgeball, ICL's Club of the Year 2023, is at the eye of the storm. After 16 years of growth, we’ve learned Dodgeball is simple, addictive, competitive, and most importantly, fun. We hold weekly training sessions in Ethos on Tuesday and Friday, and have been recognised for our work on inclusion, especially with newcomers and women. Here you can prepare for British Dodgeball matches, or just blow off some steam and chuck balls at people for a few hours. We have 3 Men’s Teams and 2 Women’s Teams in BUCS leagues, where last season both our Men’s and Women’s 1st Teams reached the National Championship Final's Day and our Women's 1s became National Champions. When not Dodging, Ducking, Dipping, Diving, or Dodging, we’re enjoying our socials. You can find us at the Union or tearing up the city with pub crawls, trampolining, and film nights (including a certain Underdog Story). And if that’s not enough, join us on our annual European Tour, with past locations like Copenhagen, Naples, and Porto. For more information, find us at the Welcome Fair or on Instagram @imperialdodgeball – come drop in on a session, we’re looking forward to meeting you! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Drama (ICSM)
societies.description: From backstage to costumes, acting, writing and directing, ICSM Drama welcomes anyone with an interest in theatre. This year, we're taking on 'The Good Doctor' based on the works of Chekhov for our Autumn performance, and then hitting the stage again in Spring for our Main Production, which is written by one of our own members! We also have smaller productions throughout the year like our One-Week-Play (a play we put together and rehearse in just one week!). We even have a play dedicated just to the incoming freshers, ever-so-aptly-titled Freshers Plays, so you can get to know us all! Even if acting isn't quite up your alley, you can also get involved in our creative, backstage and technical teams! Our production teams work tirelessly behind the scenes, working on lights, sound, costume, make-up, props, advertising and much much more. You'll be sure to find something that fits you! So come on down to our stall at Freshers Fair to say hello! We can't wait to meet you! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: DramSoc
societies.description: We do everything related to theatre: acting, set, costume, lighting, sound, writing, stage management, directing, production, and more. There’s plenty to get involved in! DramSoc own and operate the full range of state-of-the-art entertainment equipment, and our technical team run events across college, from MTSoc shows to Summer Ball. We take pride in training our members as theatre technicians, actors and directors. We run weekly workshops, including backstage tours, improvisation, set-building, lighting design, and much more, and many of our alumni graduate to become theatre professionals. We stage 2 plays per term, with recent productions including Romeo and Juliet, Waiting for Godot, and a 5 star Edinburgh Fringe show. We produce a range of work written by students, and established playwrights. This really is the place to be if you love theatre! To hear about opportunities to join the team (auditions, workshops, etc) join our mailing lists at dramsoc.org/talk. For general queries, contact president@dramsoc.org. To hire DramSoc for your event, contact techdir@dramsoc.org. Follow us on instagram @ic_dramsoc or havew a look at our website http://dramsoc.org/ to see what we’re all about! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: EFDS Soc
