societies.name: Effective Altruism
societies.description: This is important since some problems in the world are far more pressing than others and some solutions to them are enormously more effective than others. Some examples of problems the community has worked on include preventing malaria in the developing world, ending animal factory farming, and protecting the long-term future from global catastrophic risks including pandemics or misaligned advanced AI. Our society focuses on supporting students interested in careers that have a large positive impact on the world. We run speaker events with experts, an 8-week introduction programme, a technical reading group on AI Safety, and other events including hackathons and socials. CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Electrical Engineering
societies.description: We kick off the year with our Mums and Dads scheme, pairing freshers with seasoned second, third, and fourth-years to help them settle in. From there, you can look forward to a variety of socials, from bar nights (think Sushisamba and mini golf) to pub crawls and black-tie dinners. But we offer much more than just social events. We also host industry talks with leading companies, our renowned Careers Fair, and career panels — each designed to connect you with potential employers and industry leaders from companies such as Apple, Qualcomm and P&G. Get to know our committee below, and be sure to follow @EESoc on Instagram for the latest updates. We look forward to welcoming you to our community! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Endocrinology
societies.description: 🔥 What's in Store for 2023-24: 📚 Educational Extravaganza: In the previous academic year, we set the stage with a sensational tutorial series for first and second-year BMB and MBBS students, receiving rave reviews and participation. But this year, brace yourself as we level up! We're expanding to create a tutorial series meticulously tailored to the clinical curriculum for our third-year MBBS students. Get ready to elevate your knowledge to new heights! 🎙️ Epic Conferences: February brought us our inaugural conference that featured six awe-inspiring talks from renowned endocrinologists. This year, we promise an even grander spectacle, with a broader range of topics that will take you on an exhilarating journey into the depths of endocrinology. Prepare to be amazed! 📆 Exciting Events for 2023-24: 🌟 The Unmissable Annual Endocrinology Conference 📖 Regular Tutorials for BMB and MBBS students, now including Year 3 MBBS 🌆 An Exclusive Evening for Endocrinology BSc Students 🤝 Research Opportunities Galore 🤗 EndoSoc Community: At EndoSoc, we're more than just a society; we're a warm and supportive community. When you're with us, you're among friends who share your passion. We're here to offer guidance, support, and a place where you belong. Don't miss out – we look forward to seeing you at our spectacular events! 💫🔬🌍 CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Energy
societies.description: We are a student group open to anyone interested in the energy sector. The society aims to provide its members with the insight, skills and network to develop successful careers in energy-related industries. Members will be able to take part in various events throughout the year - Great opportunity to work on a real-life project, which is run in partnership with energy companies. Themes for this year include geothermal, nuclear fusion, and storage technology. Talks and networking events are hosted with speakers from diverse backgrounds to enable holistic industry understanding. We organise recruitment events, workshops and an annual Energy Careers Fair. Largest student-led Energy Summit in London. Co-hosted by Imperial, LSE, and UCL. A collaboration between, Imperial, LSE, UCL Energy Societies and ESCP. Students write and edit articles on energy-related topics of their choice, to be published in print. Past in-person destinations include Netherlands (STCA), France (ITER) and Oxford (JET). We hope to organise another site visit during the spring term. An idea challenge in collaboration with other London universities to encourage exchange of ideas between students and professionals. Problem statements will be defined by industry players. Monthly podcast discussing frontier technological advances with industry professionals. EnergySoc is also a great way to make friends and have fun! We hope to organise social events throughout the year for members to get together and meet like-minded people. CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Engineers Without Borders UK
societies.description: We are Engineers Without Borders UK - a global collective of people that want to radically change the way we view and practice engineering. Traditionally, advancements in our fields have often been for the primary purpose of profit. The world of the future cannot be built with this as our central motive. What we need is highly-skilled, innovative and ethical engineers who put global responsibility as their core value. This is where EWB comes in. Using our ethos: “Inspire, Upskill, Drive Change”, we want to provide Imperial students with the hands-on training they need to solve the social and environmental issues of the future. Along with hundreds of university chapters worldwide, you’ll be part of the movement that will usher in a new wave of sustainability achievement. Deliver enriching and interactive events, socials and workshops that build the skills critical to the EWB 2030 strategy Deliver enriching and interactive events, socials and workshops that build the skills critical to the EWB 2030 strategy CSP Chair / President
societies.tagline: Welcome to Engineers Without Borders UK

societies.name: ENT ( Ear Nose and Throat) Society
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Entrepreneurs
societies.description: Welcome to Imperial Entrepreneurs! No matter what course you are in - if you have an idea, want to share it, learn how to make it real or simply meet ambitious individuals, join us! We aim to give our society members a solid understanding of the process each start-up founder needs to go through to turn their idea into reality. Our objective is to host events related to innovation and entrepreneurship and allow you to find your co-founder through one of our events. This year, we are excited to present a variety of headline events, including IdeaForge, our very own incubator program designed to support innovative startups. The annual London Startup Fair will showcase emerging startups and provide valuable networking opportunities. Additionally, we will host a formal Gala Dinner to foster connections within the community. Our focus on entrepreneurship in leading new fields will feature panels and fireside chats on pioneering sectors and trends. At our social events, you will meet like-minded people with whom you can exchange ideas, have fun and make valuable friends for life. Come, listen and ask questions - we are sure you can create the next unicorn. Follow us on social media: Want to reach out? Email us at entrepreneurs@imperial.ac.uk CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Environmental
societies.description: Does the hustling London life make you want to slow down and enjoy nature? Are you anxious about the climate crisis we are currently facing? Do you want to have a more sustainable and green lifestyle? Come join ESoc! Join us at our very own secret garden for weekly gardening sessions where we grow fruit, vegetables, flowers, or simply come and chat with other members. Have a go at taking care of our lovely beehives at our beekeeping workshops during spring and summer. You don't need any experience to take part! To play our part in facing current environmental issues, we hold monthly campaign meetings in attempt to make our campus more sustainable and spark climate action. We host talks from guest speakers that discuss issues around climate, conservation, and sustainability, or provide career insights in the green sector through careers fairs. We also run sustainability workshops that teach you how to make your own eco-items such as beeswax food wraps, and fun socials like clothes swaps, thrift crawls, or Kew Gardens visits. Come along to meet like-minded people and have fun! Join our mailing list or follow our socials for the latest updates from us! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Erasmus Student Network - ESN
societies.description: ERASMUS Club is for all exchange students visiting Imperial, all Imperial students going on exchange, and in fact, anyone really! We run activities and events for members throughout the year. It's your chance to get to know a little more about the UK and some of its traditions, as well as fellow exchange students. In addition to organising weekly events and huge parties, the Erasmus committee will help you get to know each other, London, and the whole of Britain! Previous events included pub crawls, trips to Winter Wonderland, Oxford and Scotland, as well as meals and club nights in the most central locations in London! Furthermore, our Buddy System will pair you up with local Imperial students eager to show you around campus and share with you all their tips on how to make the most of your time with us. Everyone is welcome! For further information, don't hesitate to contact us at erasmus@imperial.ac.uk, or follow us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/erasmusimperial/). See you soon! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer
societies.tagline: Welcome to Erasmus Student Network - ESN

societies.name: Estonian
societies.description: Come and join! Over the course of the year, we organise various events, such as sauna nights with other societies and Estonian gatherings with Estonian students from all over the UK. Definitely not something to miss! Contact our committee members to get into EstSoc Whatsapp and Messenger chats! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: European Society
societies.description: Hey everyone! A warm welcome from the European Society! Our objective is to bring all Imperial students with an interest for Europe together. We want to think about the large issues that concern us all, through policy discussions, speaker events and visits to European or national institutions. We're also here to foster a sense of community, so you can expect many informal socials! What's more, we want to act as a hub enhancing collaboration and facilitating joint (fun) events between the national societies of the College. Join our WhatsApp group and follow our Instagram to keep up to date. Everyone is welcome, whether European or not! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Fashion & Design
societies.description: In 2024 we will again be holding our biggest event: the Imperial College Charity Fashion Show. ICCFS is going to be the biggest event this year - showcasing the fleekest trends, hottest acts and the sexiest models. Watch out for our models' auditions! If you are interested in organizing or backstage roles, please reach out as we still have a few positions to fill! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Felix
societies.description: In our pages, you will find news, investigations, opinion, and reviews on a wide variety of different topics, ranging from the environment and science, to music and the arts. Felix was first published on 9th December 1949. Since then, the paper has gone on to win national awards and break stories that have ended up in the national news. Our contributors – all former Imperial students – have achieved acclaim working for publications such as the BBC and the Financial Times. If print isn’t your preferred format, follow us on Instagram (@felix_imperial) or sign up for our weekly newsletter (see above), where we’ll send you an early digital copy of the newspaper, and give you bite-sized updates on the most important developments on campus. We aim to shed light on stories the College won’t tell you about, and to report on your experiences as students (and staff!). If you're interested in contributing, get in touch. We're also looking for many non-writer roles, including copyeditors, illustrators and photographers. Drop us an email to learn more! CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Fellwanderers (Imperial Hiking Society)
societies.description: One of London's greatest features is how easy it is to leave. When the smog and bustle of the city gets too much, join us to see Britain's wilder side, with plenty of weird and wonderful conversations along the way. We make a trip every week, mixing fast day hikes to nearby scenic spots such as the Chiltern Hills, Seven Sisters, and even the Peak District, with a few weekend trips to Dartmoor and Snowdonia.We also have end-of-term tours farther afield to the rugged heights of the Lake District or the Isle of Skye. We subsidise all train tickets and accommodation, so prices are always low. Between the hikes, we put our feet up with socials every now and again, including weekly afternoon tea and the occasional bar night. Whether you're a beginner or advanced hiker, whatever your experience or interest, you have a place in our society. For more details, please join our mailing list on Mailman: https://mailman.ic.ac.uk/mailman/listinfo/fellwanderersor email fellsoc@imperial.ac.uk. See you on the next adventure! CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Feminist
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: FemTech
societies.description: The only FemTech society in London Femtech is a rapidly booming industry that focuses on the research and development of products, technology & services to improve women’s health. Throughout history, women have always been excluded from medical trials and long-term studies due to factors such as menstruation and pregnancy. This has led to a huge gender health gap, which still persists today, whereby women are often misdiagnosed and mistreated due to the lack of understanding of the difference in symptoms between men and women. However, this is all changing. The industry has grown immensely in the past few years – more money, effort, and attention are dedicated to tackling unmet needs in female healthcare, from collecting new health data, conducting research studies, developing new forms of treatment and assistive technology, and more. As a society, we hope to: - ⁠Shine light on inspiring individuals and organisations who are changing the course of female healthcare research; - Supply a platform for learning and networking opportunities within this field - Expand this awareness and vision to a wider and more diverse community. Throughout the year, we host frequent events ranging from educational lecture series, panel talks from professional speakers, networking opportunities, startup fairs, social events, as well as our annual collaboration with the FemTechnology Summit and our most-anticipated FemTech Conference. Make sure to become a member today! CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Fencing
societies.description: We fence each of the three weapons: foil, épée, and sabre, with coached training sessions in Ethos on Mondays 6-8pm (épée and sabre coaching) and Tuesdays 8-10pm (foil coaching). If you need kit you must fill in a form before you attend the session! A link to the form will be sent out weekly. We have plenty of BUCS squads with 3 Men's teams and 2 Women's teams, allowing fencers to compete at all levels. Novice and intermediate fencers have the opportunity to compete at tournaments with others of similar ability throughout the year. We run a beginner's course on Mondays 6-7/7-8pm throughout term 1 and 2 starting from week 3 for those who are new to fencing. We are a very relaxed and friendly club and are one of the most socially active at Imperial, organising social events throughout the year. To keep up to date with trainings, events and socials, sign up to our mailing list here: http://eepurl.com/dI4czz To join the club, purchase the Imperial Athlete membership and then our membership. Then, if you are planning to come to coached sessions, please buy the £20 membership as well. If you are in the novice course you do not need to buy this. Please also make sure you can access Ethos, by buying their basic student membership. If you want to join one of our teams, please email us at fencing@ic.ac.uk CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Filipino Society
societies.description: Overall, our aim as a society is to help provide a fun and loving atmosphere for everyone with positive vibes only! So what are you waiting for? Join the ICL Filipino society today!!! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Filmsoc
societies.description: We show a wide range of films both new and old, from hidden gems to timeless classics and from all over the world. For the membership fee of only £6 we're willing to offer a lot. You will have access to free twice-weekly screenings at college curated by our committee with snacks, and on top of this will be able to buy discounted tickets to Filmsoc trips and events, making use of the exciting city we are a part of. Sounds like a good deal to us! Events from previous years have ranged from classic shown with live scores, screenings of new films followed by Q&As with directors, film quizzes in central London and and annual trip to the brilliant London Film Festival. Mostly though we want to create a friendly and stimulating environment to enjoy cinema! We encourage suggestions and requests from our members to keep our programme spontaneous and enjoyable. Whether you're a real buff or just vaguely interested in movies, we'd love to meet you! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Finance
societies.description: Our events are aimed at providing our members with information about job opportunities in the City, a chance to talk to and network with industry contacts, and information useful for succeeding in your later career. We also hope to give members a chance to learn about what a job in the industry consists of, and if it's something that they'd be interested in pursuing. We specifically promote roles in investment banks, accountancy firms, private equity, hedge funds, and investment managers, and supplement your education with material helpful to applications and interviews. With a wide range of opportunities such as speeches from leading experts in their fields, term-long trading competitions, and even office visits, there are events for everyone with an interest in our field or even just curiosity to learn more. And as membership is free, there's no reason to not join! WORKING WEBSITE LINK BELOW! FIND OUT EVERYTHING ABOUT OUR EVENTS AND SIGN UP TO LECTURE COURSES ON WEBSITE CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: First Aid
societies.description: At Imperial College First Aid Society (ICFAS), we’ll make sure you never have to wonder again! Every week, we run interactive first aid sessions that teach you the vital skills to stay calm, confident, and capable when it matters most. You’ll learn how to save lives, handle emergencies, and make a real difference! Want to take it even further? Through ICFAS, you can put your skills into action by becoming a volunteer First Aider with St John Ambulance, where the possibilities are endless. You will yourself at some of the UK’s biggest, most exciting and bizarre events, from tennis at Wimbledon, football, cricket, and rugby matches to the Lord Mayor’s Show, Notting Hill Carnival, and even world record attempts! Whatever tickles your fancy, there’s an event waiting for you. Along the way, you’ll discover just how far first aid can take you. Whether it’s treating patients, training new first aiders or cadets, getting involved in logistics or fundraising, or even driving an ambulance, there are countless ways to get involved! Join ICFAS today to meet amazing people, develop life-saving skills, boost your CV, and open the door to unforgettable experiences where you can make a difference and have fun doing it! 💚 CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Football - Mens
societies.description: Regardless of your ability level, age or personality, there is a place within our club for everyone who shares the love of the beautiful game! All of our 11-a-side teams compete in the London University (LUSL) leagues and cups, with the top four teams also competing nationally in BUCS leagues and cups. Our home ground is Harlington Sports Ground (Fortress Harlington), where we train on Monday and Thursday nights and play on Wednesdays and Saturdays. There is a rich history of success in the club, with three promotions in the last three seasons alone and 18 BUCS titles in the last 10 years. This has instilled a strong winning mentality which gives us the confidence to build on our success and continue to excel and reinforce our status as the best university football club in London. The social side of the club is second to none, with all members gathering as one club for bar nights after matches alongside numerous events throughout the year including pub crawls, formal dinners, tours (including domestic and international) and much more. For more information, find us on Instagram: @icuafc CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Football - Mens (ICSM)
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Football - Mens (RSM)
societies.description: In addition, members get to take part in the prestigious Bottle Match versus the lowly CSM - something that all RSM teams get to look forward to, with an atmosphere fitting for the 2nd oldest varsity match in the world. With games Saturday and Wednesday most weeks there is always the need for depth in the squad and with several players leaving us this year there is no reason not to give us a go. Any player, RSM or not, is welcome and you'll get the chance to take part in Freshers Training at the start of the year. We pride ourselves in having the most cohesive, enjoyable and enthusiastic football side at Imperial College. 'A team is the sum of all its parts', and we encourage our members to get involved in every training session, match and social that they can! Follow our Instagram @rsmafc and join our Facebook group by searching RSM Football 23/24. Keep an eye out there for details on our Freshers Training! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Football - Womens
societies.description: More than just a club, ICWFC is home for anyone at Imperial with an interest in football.We’re a family that welcomes everyone—whether you’ve played for years or are completely new to the sport. With four 11-a-side teams and a competitive futsal team, there's a place for every ability level, from high-level players to total beginners. Don’t let being new put you off—we’re all about giving everyone the chance to get involved and grow. For many of our members, ICWFC is a highlight of their university experience, offering a much-needed balance to the intense academic life at Imperial. Here’s what we get up to on the pitch: Weekly training sessions on Monday evenings (8–10 PM) at Harlington Sports GroundsBUCS matches for our 1st, 2nd, and 3rd teams on WednesdaysFutsal BUCS matches on a SaturdayLUSL fixtures for our mixed-ability 4th team on SundaysTwo massive Varsity events—one against the Medics, and one against LSE But it doesn’t stop there.We’re just as passionate about our off-pitch activities. Expect: A wide range of socials, from wild nights out to chill evenings inTrips to watch professional women’s football matchesClub dinners and collab socials with other unis and societiesA subsidised mini-tour in the UK and an unforgettable summer tour abroadWhether you're here to compete, to learn, or just to make mates, ICWFC has something for you. Come join the family  ❤️⚽ CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Football - Womens (ICSM)
societies.description: Our socials also rival many clubs - Brunches, cocktails, bowling, laser-tag our year is filled with FUN. We also have non-drinking socials regularly and there is never pressure to drink. Our sports nights are the highlight of everyone’s week! We pride ourselves on creating an inclusive club where everyone feels comfortable and welcome. Our goal is to make everyone feel that they can be themselves and part of our family. Along with all these events we also have two mini tours in the year: Girls Tour and NAMS. The best weekends of your life! We also provide our girls with plenty of academic support - with regular tutorials, mocks and also an entire note bank! If you want to play football, attend incredibly fun events all year round, receive all the notes you could possibly want and make friends for life then IMWFC will be your home away from home. Join IMWFC!!! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Forensics and Criminology
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Formula 1
societies.description: We bring you grand-prix watch-alongs every race weekend with our captivating fan-zone that creates the ideal setting for insightful discussions and shared exhilaration. Alongside this, this year we're gearing up for a whole host of engaging social events – from the adrenaline-pumping F1 Arcade battles to invigorating go-karting trips that will awaken your inner Schumacher (or Latifi). And for those who are interested in the technical side of the sport, we host talks, featuring F1 alumni, who provide unique insights into the industry. You can also attend our hands-on technical workshops, including the intriguing FastF1 project. In between races, stay connected with our social platforms. Explore regular Instagram updates for the latest and breaking news in the F1-world. During race-weeks, look out for our analyses that will feed your F1 enthusiasm. Ready to be a part of this F1 family? Simply log into the union, hit the join membership button, and embrace a community that shares your love for F1. Make sure to follow us on instagram, and join the WhatsApp Group through the linktree in our Instagram bio, where all the important announcements will be made. This year promises a series of extraordinary events that will elevate your F1 experience with the university, so keep an eye out for announcements as the dates draw closer!

societies.name: French
societies.description: Follow us on social media to hear more and join The Society now! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Friends of Médecins Sans Frontières
societies.description: From Ukraine to Palestine, MSF provides crucial medical assistance to those who need it most. We host speaker events and training sessions led by MSF mission team members, offering insights into working in medical aid. Learn what it's like to work in crisis settings with our Makeathon Competition, cross-university Hackathon and Missing Maps Event! We also organise a multitude of exciting fundraising events from fun runs to film screenings and quiz nights to support MSF's vital missions worldwide. If you’re passionate about global health, dream to get involved in humanitarian aid or simply appreciate the incredible work of MSF and want to show your support, join our society! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer
societies.tagline: Welcome to Friends of Médecins Sans Frontières

societies.name: Friends of Palestine
societies.description: Whether or not you are Palestinian, if you want to come show your support, appreciate the culture of Palestine, or understand more about the conflict, this is the place to come. We are a secular society, not affiliated to any political party. Join us for a year filled with insightful educational talks and fun socials as we showcase Palestinian history, culture, and heritage for everyone at Imperial to learn about! Our previous events include talks with prominent academics and lawyers about the situation in Palestine through a Human Rights & International Law lens, a cultural-themed "Open Mic Night" fundraiser, documentary screenings, as well as collaborations with other societies at Imperial. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Futsal
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Game Development
societies.description: Dive into a vibrant community where game programmers, artists, designers, and enthusiasts unite to celebrate the world of gaming. Whether you're a seasoned professional or a budding game developer, our society offers the ideal platform to learn, collaborate, and showcase your talents. Be a part of our journey as we explore, innovate, and redefine gaming together! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Gaming and Esports
societies.description: Joining a team is one of the best ways to have a tight circle of players from Imperial, whether you're looking to compete at the highest level in the national university leagues, or just to play casual weekly games. Our annual Varsity LAN against UCL is our keystone event of the year, hosted either on-site or in one of London's largest esports studios. You'll also have opportunities to meet other student gamers within Central London by joining our viewing parties of international tournaments, our socials, or by getting involved in our annual charity livestream! For those who are less interested in the competitive side, we run weekly in-person gaming sessions on Wednesday afternoons playing all sorts of console-based games. ICLGE has several consoles, Nintendo Switches and a huge selection of games to choose from during our meetups! The best way to stay updated is by joining our Discord server: https://discord.com/invite/CNJ5S25 CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Gazette
societies.description: The ICSM Gazette was formed after the merger of three medical schools into Imperial. It is based on its predecessors the St Mary's Hospital Gazette and the Charing Cross Gazette. Today the Gazette is read by over 3000 alumni of St Mary's, Charing Cross and Imperial College medical schools, as well as current students. We are always keen for more students to get involved in writing for and taking photos for the Gazette, if you would like to get involved please email us at icsm-gazette@imperial.ac.uk. CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: General Practice (ICSM)
societies.description: CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Geology
societies.description: The best and most hotly anticipated events organised by the society – we head off to places of great natural beauty all over the UK to sample the best geology our country has to offer. Recent destinations include Norfolk, South Wales and North Yorkshire. A day in the field is followed a lovingly cooked dinner by the committee, a fancy dress dinner, and a chance get to know your fellow rock-enthusiasts. We organise evening/lunchtime talks throughout the year. Lecturers, PhD students and field experts from outside and within the department give fascinating lectures about up-and-coming topics in geology or about their own current research. Drinks, nibbles and mingling follows. A long-standing tradition where six top geologists from across the country are invited to take part in a full day of presentations on a chosen topic. This event is very popular, not just because of the quality our speakers, but because we provide free lunch and an evening drinks reception, all topped off with a celebratory dinner at a local restaurant. Symposium 2024 was called “Geology on Other Planets” – a series of short lectures by geologists leading the way in planetary research - but the event tends to alternate between both planetary and sustainable themes so make sure you come to both over your time at Imperial so you don't miss out! CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Geophysics
societies.description: We are not open just to the geophysicists and geologists; students from all subject areas are welcome to join and no special geoscience skills are required! All you need is an appreciation of the applications of physics and maths to the natural world! Throughout the year we will be holding various events, including seminars from professional geophysicists, outreach days with schools, fieldtrips to see geophysical methods in action and of course some social outings - all of which end with some drinks and good chat. We aim to build our reputation with geophysical companies and to provide you valuable advice about future careers through this. So if you're interested in how the world works or want to see how maths and physics can be applied to our planet, the Geophysics Society is here for you! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: German
societies.description: The German Society is now entering its 30th year of existence -- each year we organise many events such as club nights, pub crawls, outings to German restaurants, movie nights (with subtitles) as well as joint events with German societies from other London universities. We also visit exhibitions and attend lectures related to current political affairs across the city. Our members come from a very diverse background. As well as Austrians, Swiss and Germans spending a year or their entire degree abroad, we have many other students who will or already have spent a year in a German-speaking university and other students who just want to brush up their German. So why should you join? German, Swiss and Austrian students have the chance to escape their unknown surroundings from time to time and talk to like-minded people. Other students will have the opportunity to practise German and experience German culture. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Gliding
societies.description: Have you always dreamed of flying, taking in the view from above or performing thrilling aerobatics?Imperial College Gliding Club can help you make that dream come true - we provide training for all levels of experience at low cost. Once you've flown solo and converted to one of our two high-performance single-seaters, nothing will stop you from flying hundreds of kilometres cross-country, participating in competitions or getting an aerobatic rating! On top of the weekend trips, we also organise tours during the winter to Scotland or Wales, giving you the opportunity to fly from a different airfield and make use of ridge lift or even wave. ICGC is not only about flying - we organise several social events throughout the year, such as bar nights and dinners. We also take part in events organised by other Junior pilots, which is a great way to get to know glider pilots all over the UK. We always have a lot of fun together! If this sounds like something you'd be interested in - come for a flight and try it out for yourself! ICGC runs trips every Saturday and Sunday. These trips are open to all members regardless of experience and are the best way to get started with gliding. Sign-up forms are sent out every Monday for the following weekend. Please join our WhatsApp group to get started! If you have any questions please first refer to the FAQs on our website then contact gliding@imperial.ac.uk. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Golf
societies.description: We host biweekly driving range sessions open to beginner, social and team players at Greenwich Peninsula driving range, a complex with a stunning view overlooking the Thames and Inrange tracking technology to play games and virtual courses. We are proud to have a strongly competitive mixed team playing in the BUCS Division 1A. Fixtures are played on Wednesdays on some of the UK’s best courses. We have demonstrated to be the most prominent golf team amongst London universities and our aim is to bring Imperial College in the BUCS Premier league. We offer membership to a limited number at Ealing Golf Club, where we also host our regular social rounds open to golfers of all handicap levels. Outside of the course, we are excited to provide to our members and their guests our yearly pub golf, minigolf nights and all our unmissable social events. Membership to golf society includes: discounted range and training sessions, a heavily subsidized membership to Ealing Golf Club (limited number), funded events and socials, and a chance to be part of the competitive team following trials. Come see us at freshers fair! Contact us for more details at golf.club@imperial.ac.uk and follow us for news and events: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/icgolfclub/ CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Gospel Choir
societies.description: We are a diverse bunch of people and everyone is most welcome to join our family - even if you have never sung Gospel before! We have enjoyed performing in a wide variety of events from our own Christmas and Easter concerts to being one of the 8 finalists at the University Gospel Choir of the Year Competition in 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2015. We regularly perform at events staged by fellow Imperial societies as well as external events which have included backing X-Factor finalists on live television, performing on Premier Gospel Radio and at the Great Exhibition Road Festival as well as many Imperial College society performances (East Meets West, Mega Maalai, UNICEF, Afrogala). We rehearse weekly on Mondays from 6pm in the City and Guild Building, Room 300. We frequently have socials (often involving food) so there is always something to look forward to! We hope to see you soon! A good voice is not a prerequisite; all you need is enthusiasm and a heart for community! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Hindu Society
societies.description: Our partnership with the National Hindu Students Forum (NHSF) paves the way for nationwide networking, dynamic inter-university collaborations, and exclusive access to amazing national events. ᴡʜʏ ʙᴇ ᴀ ᴍᴇᴍʙᴇʀ ᴏꜰ ʜɪɴᴅᴜ ꜱᴏᴄɪᴇᴛʏ? 🌟 𝗦𝗣𝗘𝗖𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗨𝗟𝗔𝗥 𝗘𝗩𝗘𝗡𝗧𝗦 – Immerse yourself in a world of wonder as we orchestrate an inter-university ball captivating over 300 attendees, host a grand Holi celebration right on campus, and curate a vibrant mela that pays homage to our rich culture. 🎭 𝗨𝗡𝗣𝗔𝗥𝗔𝗟𝗟𝗘𝗟𝗘𝗗 𝗩𝗔𝗥𝗜𝗘𝗧𝗬 – From captivating dance performances to engaging sports activities, from cultural showcases to profound religious experiences, and from enriching educational endeavours to fostering a deep sense of community, our offerings cater to every facet of your interests. ⚽ 𝗧𝗛𝗥𝗜𝗟𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗦𝗣𝗢𝗥𝗧𝗦 – Kick off your competitive spirit with regular football, netball, kho-kho, and badminton training sessions. Seize the extraordinary chance to participate in regional and national tournaments alongside thousands of fellow students. We are more than a society; we are a family and we would love you to be a part of it! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: History
societies.description: We run socials, such as pub crawls and quizzes, as well day trips to museums and cinema trips for historical films. We also host free lectures from leading academics, across any topic - anything from the Paris Commune, to the Opium War, to the history of witchcraft. You can also expect collaborations with other societies at Imperial and at other London universities! You can find the links to the mailing list, whatsapp group chat and more here! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Hockey
societies.description: We hold regular socials throughout the year, such as curry night, black-tie dinners, our own club night hosted in central London, and plenty more inter-club events to keep you entertained! Two tours are organised each year, both within the country and further afield. Fresher’s tour is a weekend away in the UK; a great chance to get to know everyone in the club. Summer tours send 20-30 members of our club to play hockey and holiday in the sun - previous destinations include Vietnam, Trinidad & Barbados, and Germany & The Netherlands. With around 150 active members, and a huge alumni network, our social events are among the best at Imperial and we pride ourselves in combining quality hockey with a great social atmosphere. Follow us @ichockeyclub on Instagram! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Hockey (RSM)
societies.description: RSM Hockey is open to any players from any department who fancies playing hockey without running laps and doing chin-ups. We welcome all abilities, from not knowing which end of the stick to hold, to anyone who used to be semi-pro but just wants to have fun again. We’ve got men's and women's team in the LUSL League and a mixed team that plays friendly matches. We not only have fun on the pitch, but we also regularly hold events in the Union Bar as well as other exotic locations (such as Hammersmith's finest, the William Morris!). The main event in our calendar is the Bottle Match, the 2nd oldest varsity in the world, (banter worthy of the national press, port, chanting and hangovers) which is amazing fun, complete memory loss optional (for those who enjoy such things), and will this year be held in Cornwall. Training takes place Tuesday evenings at Harlington Sports Ground (meet in the RSM Foyer 5pm), and matches are usually on Sundays. Look forward to seeing you there! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Hockey Mens (ICSM)
societies.description: Whether you’re an expert at hockey or a complete newbie looking for a good time we have a spot for you. We have a mixture of both competitive and newbie teams with great socials every week. Our club is open to anyone, from any course, not just medics. In fact, almost half of our club is made up from non medics, because of our inclusivity and camaraderie. Monday: Training 6:45pm - 8:30pm (Location: Indian Gymkhana Hockey Club) Wednesdays: BUCS league games, Sports Night starting at 7:00pm Sundays: LUSL league games The fun continues off the pitch with our legendary socials. We have weekly sports nights at Reynolds Bar, along with other great events like Christmas dinner and mixed socials with women’s hockey. Also our domestic and international tour each year guarantee lifelong memories. We support our members with academic help sessions though out the year, and a network of friends in older years provide invaluable support. We will provide hockey sticks for those who need If you have any questions get in touch with us via our instagram @imperial_medicals_hockey_club CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Hockey Womens (ICSM)
societies.description: Want to play some hockey, come to the best socials, and make the greatest friends? Then come join the ICSM Ladies Hockey family! Whether you are a complete newbie, or hockey Olympian, medic or non-medic; looking to try something new or just something to keep fit, ICSMLHC is the club for you!???? We start the week with coach-led training sessions on Monday evenings to build our skills and prepare us for our matches. On Wednesdays, we field 3 teams of varying abilities where everybody is guaranteed a game followed by fancy dress themed sports nights at the infamous Reynolds Bar! We also have a more relaxed Saturday morning mixed ability team where anybody from any team can play and chat at post-match teas. We also compete in cup competitions with other universities and are reigning champions of the London medical school hockey cup! Off the pitch we go on mixed tours, have team dinners, an annual Christmas dinner, help with exams, as well as rounding off the season with our annual black-tie dinner! Voted as 2023/24 ICSM Sports Club of the year, ICSM Ladies Hockey can offer you as much or as little sport as you like but it guarantees a great time and a true family ?? CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Hungarian
societies.description: Our e-mail is: hungarian@imperial.ac.uk

societies.name: Ice Hockey
societies.description: We’ll be running on and off ice training sessions alongside our popular “Learn to skate” sessions. We’ll equip you with all necessary kit, protecting you from on-ice falls and flying pucks. You will enjoy weekly training sessions and competitions in the British University Ice Hockey Association (BUIHA) league. We provide full kits, transport to trainings and matches, letting you simply enjoy playing the game. Our A-team competes in Division 1 of BUIHA league, striking hits and sniping goals. But don't worry if you've never played or skated before! After our a few training sessions you'll be ready to join our B-team in Division 2 of the non-checking (but full contact) league or C-team, a competitive and fun team for beginners! All leagues' seasons culminate in the National Championships in Sheffield. Our main event is the varsity match against UCL Yetis, which most recently saw the Devils take home a confident 9-4 victory, a highlight on the calendar. You'll make new friends through trainings and socials, which is a great time for team bonding in the evening after a training session. For new players, this is the best opportunity to try the sport! Email ice-hockey@imperial.ac.uk or check our social media for more info! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Immunology
societies.description: This year, we plan to do the following: Make sure to follow our  Instagram  and  subscribe to our newsletter  to receive updates on our events! Getting membership will give you access to our events, but does not automatically subscribe you to our newsletter - so make sure to fill out the form if you want to receive updates from us! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Imperial Ceilidh Society
societies.description: A Ceilidh (pronounced kay-lee) is a social gathering with traditional Scottish and Irish folk music and social dancing. Each Ceilidh is led by a Caller, who guides you through the dances, ensuring everyone is up to speed and no one’s feet are squashed in the process. No previous experience is required- all dances will be taught on the night (just bring your enthusiasm and possible enjoyment of getting dizzy)! Even if you're not sure about dancing, you can still come for the live music and see how you feel as the night goes on! Ceilidhs are also a great way to meet new people and make new friends, so even more reason to bring your friends along and get mingling! If any of this sounds up your street, then sign up to our mailing list below and we’ll let you know when the next event will be. Everyone is welcome, so get your dancing shoes on (or just regular ones if you don’t have any) and see you soon! CALLING ALL IMPERIAL MUSICIANS: We are always looking for more eager musicians to join our Ceilidh Band! If you have experience playing folk music or would like to try it out for the first time, don’t hesitate to add your name, instrument and email to the form below, and we’ll get in touch! Musician Sign Up Form 2025-2026 Mailing List Sign Up Form 2025-2026 CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Imperial Cubing League
societies.description: Join us as we embark on thrilling journeys to WCA competitions, where we'll support and cheer each other on. But that's not all—we also have exciting plans to organize our very own competitions, providing opportunities for our members to showcase their skills and challenge themselves in a friendly and supportive environment. Rubik's Cube solving is not just about speed. It's a world of intrigue that encompasses blindfolded solving, twisted puzzles, and a plethora of exciting variations. Explore the diverse facets of the Rubik's Cube with us, engaging in captivating challenges and expanding your puzzle-solving horizons. Join our club today and be part of a vibrant community united by the love for Rubik's Cubes. We look forward to your joining! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Imperial Marrow
societies.description: We have 3 main goals: •Recruiting people to join the Stem Cell Registry, offering hope to patients in need of a stem cell transplant •Fundraising for the charity, ensuring it has the resources to maintain the registry and facilitate transplants •Spread awareness of blood cancers & disorders and the need for stem cell transplants. We aim to host many fun events throughout the year in order to achieve these goals! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Indian
societies.description: We’ll begin with our annual Meet and Greet, a three-course dinner giving Freshers the chance to get to know our society and Mums and Dads where new members are paired with older years for guidance and advice on university life. We'll move onto Friction, our annual Bollywood club night attracting freshers across London! We also organise Just Bollywood, the premier national inter-university fusion dance competition, that takes place in early December. In January, we host Utsav - our flagship ball that has 300 members held in a banqueting hall with dance performances, open-bar and photo booths! IndianSoc is perhaps best known for our annual culture and variety show, East Meets West, currently in its 30th year! As the longest-running student show in the UK, EMW showcases the varied music, drama and dance talent here at Imperial, with stunning performances from our own members, as well as other university societies such as PSoc and Malaysian Society. At the heart of all the fun, all of our events continue to raise thousands of pounds for charity every year. CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Indian National Student Association
societies.description: Join this colossal network of past and present Indian students in the UK. The organization has two-fold objectives. First, to promote the well-being and protect the interests of Indian students coming to the UK for their students. Second, to nurture future leaders and ambassadors for India who could represent India well in their personal capacity. Guided by the principal of ‘India First’, INSA also focuses on maintaining the rich traditions, the myriad of colours and cultural heritage of India. INSA presently has members from thirty-five universities across the UK, with particularly strong presence in fourteen universities including University of Cambridge, University of Oxford and Imperial College London. CSP Chair / President
societies.tagline: Welcome to Indian National Student Association

societies.name: Infectious Diseases Society
societies.description: Are you fascinated by the enchanting world of infectious diseases? If not, you soon will be!!! With a calendar full of exciting events, we always have something to be inspired by and look forward to🦠🧫 📊 Public Health Events: Possible our proudest achievement over the past 4 years! We’ve perfected the art of delivering events that combine portfolio worthy research workshops, impactful awareness and fundraising campaigns and of course the infectious vibe that brings together our community of like-minded enthusiasts. 📚 Educational Extravaganza: We have loads of revision support upcoming for BMB and MBBS students. First year medical students, we’re part of a huge 4-society collaboration for a POM series. And first year biomedical students, we have brilliant INTS sessions. Finally, year 3 students' we bring you tutorials of only the highest quality. March last year brought us a massive conference with immunosoc. With students of all levels and courses coming together, we featured five awe-inspiring talks, a careers panel and 3 interactive workshops. This year, we promise an even grander spectacle, with a broader range of topics!!! At IDSoc we’re about bringing people together. It doesn’t matter what course you’re from, we’re here to help each other learn, grow and make meaningful connections with fellow students. With so much on offer we’ll soon have you hooked on everything infection. We can’t wait to see you there! 😄🧑‍🤝‍🧑🦠 CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Investment
societies.description: We give you the knowledge, network, and experience to break into finance. Whether you are a fresher or a postgrad, ICIS is the place to learn, connect, and stand out. Find more on our website and follow us on social media! We can’t wait to see you on campus! Feel free to contact us: icu.investmentsociety@ic.ac.uk CSP Chair / President

societies.name: IQ (Imperial College LGBT+)
societies.description: Our goal is to offer a friendly welcoming space for all students across the LGBTQ+ community, regardless of where you are in the process of coming out and whether you're a fresher or in your final year. Every week during term time we aim to run at least one event where you can meet other LGBTQ+ folks, be it a quiet film evening, a big night out, a cultural day trip or on tour. We recognise the fantastic diversity within the LGBTQ+ community and that our experiences are not the same, therefore we also organise events to offer seperate spaces for specific subgroups within our community. These are run by our intersectional officers: If you ever feel uncomfortable, want someone to talk to regarding your sexual orientation and gender identity or have suffered anti-LGBTQ+ discrimination, our Welfare Officer is here to help. They're your first point of contact for existing College and Union support services and are there if you just want a quiet chat. CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Iranian
societies.description: For Iranians that are coming to Imperial from all over the world, we wish to create an atmosphere that resembles home; and for those wishing to learn about the Iranian culture, or even pick up bits of the language, this society will provide the environment and means to do so. Together, we will be celebrating Iranian cultural events (such as Yalda night and Nowrouz) have weekly gatherings to watch Iranian movies, play games or listen to poetry, and benefit from talks by notable speakers and scientists. This society is a great opportunity to get to know your fellow Iranians, so get the membership and turn up to events. We look forward to seeing you. Follow us on Facebook to find out about our events. If you have any queries, email us on: Iranians@imperial.ac.uk CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Irish
societies.description: Whether you're Irish, a lover of Irish culture, or have never even been to Ireland, this is the society for you! Join us for good craic and become part of our Irish community. Everyone knows that no one parties harder than the Irish, so be prepared for class events, including pub crawls, ceilidhs and karaoke nights! And you won’t want to miss out on our annual St Patrick's Day celebrations. “11/10 would join again if I was still at Imperial” – past member “Passing up an event with the Irish Society is like turning down free food, something a student should never do” – current member “You guys are all so friendly! I love you!” – random man in bar from Irish Society Pub Crawl 2016 With membership free this year, there is no excuse not to join. Follow our instagram @icirishsoc to keep up with the events and craic through the year. CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Islamic
societies.description: Regular events and services for everyone include an engaging range of talks, socials & dinners, trips and sporting events. The Prayer Room (PR) is the heart of Muslim life on campus, where you can come and pray all five daily established prayers in congregation. It is also a place which you can relax in whenever you have a break, want to eat something, or just feel like socialising. Friday prayers are also organised for both men and women, and these are held in the Union building. Come and surround yourself with people that will help you worship the Most Merciful, and develop to become righteous, upright members of your society. If you are a non-Muslim and want to learn about this beautiful way of life, we are here to help and offer you guidance from its sources. Whoever you are, the Islamic Society is here to cultivate YOU. Visit www.theisoc.com for more details! Join our Official 2020 Freshers group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/3499262110086292 CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Israeli
societies.description: The Israeli Society at Imperial aims to be a place where people from all backgrounds — academic or otherwise — can come together to embrace Israel’s culture, history, impressive entrepreneurial and tech scene, and - most importantly - eat lots of good houmous. Beyond on-campus events like socials and visiting STEM lecturers, our society has successfully run an award-winning 8-day Tech Trip since 2017: a week of exploring the country’s start-ups, culture, history, cuisine, and a bit of nightlife as well! We also run a programme in the summer to connect students with internships at local startups and research positions at leading STEM universities. We are a non-religious cultural society and strive to be apolitical with our events and affiliations. If you’re interested in learning more about the start-up nation with a community of entrepreneurs and the chance to travel and make memories that last a lifetime then come join us - all are welcome! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Italian
societies.description: The society for all Italians, Italians at heart, Italian wanna-be's, non-Italians who have an italian great-great-granparent, princess-saving plumbers, and people who just love our Bel Paese. Italiani, Italians at heart, Italian wanna-be's, non-Italians who have an italian great-great-great-granparent, princess-saving plumbers, people who just love our Bel Paese - WELCOME! This is where you can find help coping with the very peculiar British food and make up for the lack of nonna's pasta; where you'll be able find people to watch together the Serie A; or where you can have some fiery political discussion while enjoying some Chianti and pecorino. If you like five-star food, first-class wine, fine arts or friendly people then this is the society for you! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Jain
societies.description: From building lasting friendships to experiencing meaningful moments, there’s something for everyone. We’re all about creating a vibrant and welcoming community, and we'd love you to be a part of the Imperial Jain Society. Whether you’re Jain or simply curious about the faith, we’re opening our doors wide for everyone to learn something new, relax and make new friends. We’ve got an exciting year ahead packed with events, for example we're hoping for: a trip to the Jain Derasar (temples), a V&A museum tour to see ancient Jain murtis, a buzzing Diwali event with food stands, garba classes, escape rooms, treasure hunts and board game + debate nights. Plus, we’ll have inspiring talks from incredible speakers, including Jain nuns and hopefully a spoken word artist! Importantly, expect plenty of Indian snacks, sweets, and mithai at our events to keep things exciting. You don’t need to be Jain to join. We’re here to share the beautiful principles of Jainism—including seva (selfless service), ahimsa (non-violence), and living a mindful, peaceful life. It’s a perfect way to unwind after a hectic Imperial week and connect with like-minded friends in a positive space. So come along, bring your friends, and be part of something exciting. We can’t wait to meet you and make this year truly unforgettable. Here's a wonderful Jain principle: Parasparopagraho Jīvānām - "Live and Let Live"! See you soon at one of our events! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.description: Email List Throughout the year, we send regular emails with useful information, such as events, news and Shabbat times. If you would like to be added to the email list, contact us and we will be happy to add you. N.B. Some events posters may not be visible on public social media. In order to make sure you stay up to date and don't miss out, please please be in contact with us CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Jiu Jitsu (Aiuchi)
societies.description: Jiu Jitsu is a Japanese martial art which uses balance and movement rather than strength to defend against physical assault, so anyone can learn it! Central techniques are throws and joint locks; our training also incorporates strikes, groundwork, and weapon attacks. TRAINING INFO 2024-25: Tuesdays 8-10pm, Union Gym (Union building, 3rd Floor Beit). Saturdays 2-4pm, Union Gym. All sessions are beginner-friendly! 3 FREE TASTER SESSIONS: 3 free tasters on 11th, 18th, and 25th October (all Saturdays). If you are unsure, give it a go! We welcome all levels from complete beginners to black belts to join us! Hang around at the Union Bar after training to get to know the instructors and other club members (subsidised refreshments included). We aim to run 1-2 bigger socials this term, stay tuned! Our club is affiliated with Aiuchi Jiu Jitsu Association which has clubs across the UK. Nationals: Annual event where all the clubs come together for 1-2 days of focussed training, a great chance to get to know people and improve your jitsu! Gradings are held throughout the year, allowing you to progress through the belts during your time at Imperial. See you on the mat soon! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Ju-Jitsu
societies.description: Our club is affiliated with The Jiu Jitsu Foundation (TJJF). We meet with over 130 other affiliated clubs at competitions and gradings. Twice a year there are national competitions that our club takes part in. Come and try out Jitsu! Turn up to a session in loose clothing (such as tracksuit bottoms and a t-shirt) or email our committee for more information. Your first two weeks will be FREE! We train at Beit twice a week, at the following times: CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Judo
societies.description: We welcome all levels of players with open arms Judo, The Gentle Way, is a martial art and an Olympic sport. With full-contact sparring being a major training element, Judo is a physically demanding sport that gives you plenty of opportunity to improve your fitness through a combination of throws, pins, arm locks and strangles. Training caters to people at all levels of experience and newcomers are welcome throughout the year. We run two training sessions per week at a very affordable price and actively participate as a club in training sessions organized by other institutions. Beginner sessions are run throughout the Autumn term, where complete beginners can come to up to four sessions to try the sport out before having to decide to sign up! As a beginner, you start by learning how to fall safely before moving on to basic throwing and techniques on the ground, and within a few months you can start going to novice competitions and work your way through the grades all the way to Black belt! We offer plenty of opportunities to fight around the UK, including the National Championships in Sheffield and university team and individual competitions throughout the year. We also organize several bar nights and house parties and we even went for Judo holidays at a beautiful Spanish beach and to sunny Portugal. CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: K Pop Society
societies.description: We host a range of events weekly including dance classes, karaoke, quiz x games nights, watch parties and random play dances, and offer discounts to external K-clubbing events. We also have a dance team, ICarus, which competes in inter-uni competitions and perform covers which are uploaded to YouTube. Whether you want to showcase your skills on a stage, find people to share your interests with, or simply come and hang out every now and again, we would love to have you. Check out our YouTube, Instagram and Carrd. Make sure to sign up to our mailing list to get updates on all our activities, and we hope to see you soon! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Kabaddi
societies.description: Join one of the most successful sporting clubs at Imperial! 5x National Champions 4x London Zone Champions 4x Kabaddi Cup Winners 2x Kabaddi Championship Winners Kabaddi is an action-packed contact sport originating in India. Check out our We thrive on introducing new players to the sport. It's easy to pick up, so come along to a training session and try it out! We field men's and women's teams, and we accommodate complete beginners all the way to international players! In 2016, three of our senior players (now club alumni) represented England in the Kabaddi World Cup hosted in India. The club is one of the friendliest at Imperial. We train several times a week and are introducing Club Nights, where we get together and chill out watching some ProKabaddi from India. We have regular socials on top of that and end-of-term dinners at Christmas and Easter. And of course to top it all off - international tour, where we got to play the Polish national team in 2019! So if you want a taste of something new, or you want to meet a really nice bunch of people, IC Kabaddi is the club for you! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Karate
societies.description: Let's train, share, and grow together! Our Karate Club brings together students from a variety of karate styles to train, exchange ideas, and celebrate our differences. We don’t focus on gradings or a single style — instead, we create a friendly, inclusive space where members learn from each other and improve their fitness while having fun. Whether you’re a beginner or a seasoned black belt, you’re welcome to join us! We also take part in the annual BUCS Karate Championships, giving our members the chance to represent Imperial and experience a fun, team-based competition - no matter your current level! Training times:Thursdays, 18:00 – 20:00 in the Union Gym CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Kendo
societies.description: Kendo is a Japanese martial art that teaches traditional swordsmanship using bamboo swords and body armour. We are a beginner-friendly club so come along and try it for yourself! This ancient martial art was passed down through centuries of civil strife between the ruling Samurai classes of medieval Japan. Kendo players wear tough body armour and use bamboo swords in lieu of the steel blades used in ancient times. Imperial College Kendo Club is now in its 27th year with a glorious history. As a member, you will get the chance to represent Imperial and compete in official British Kendo Association tournaments as well as attend various Japanese cultural events throughout the year. There is even the opportunity to join our Summer International Kendo trip to Japan with club members and fellow alumni! Taster Session: 9th October 6:00 pm - 7:30 pm (Union Dining Hall) Regular Practice Sessions: Mondays (Experienced): 8:30 pm - 10:00 pm (Activity Space 1) Wednesdays (Beginners): 6:00 pm - 8:00 pm (Union Dining Hall) Wednesdays (Experienced): 8:00 pm - 9:00 pm (Union Dining Hall) Session times may sometimes change due to room booking difficulties. Therefore, please join our mailing list and our Whatsapp groupchat for weekly updates on practice times. If you would like to hear our latest updates, we highly recommend you to join our mailing list! Our weekly update sent to our subscribers will inform you of all the important details, such as changes to session times, upcoming competitions, social event and much more. If you don't want to miss the best parts of this year, please sign up for our mailing list by completing this form: https://linktr.ee/ickc CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: KnitSock
societies.description: It’s only £5 including access to ordering £8 yarn for FREE!! All levels of experience are welcome. Anyone can improve their knitting and crocheting skills - there are a lot more things you can make besides a scarf! Everyone is invited to our social events (we don’t have to just knit/ crochet all day!). Sign up for our mailing list here :) CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Krav Society
societies.description: Imperial’s only self-defence society – practical training, clear progress, confident members. Krav Maga is a modern, reality-focused self-defence system that draws on techniques from a wide range of martial arts, built around skills that work under pressure. 👉 No prior experience is needed – most members start from scratch and see progress after just a few sessions. Training builds practical technique, situational awareness, and the mindset to protect yourself and others. Our syllabus is modular and progressive, so you’ll gain solid foundations before advancing: Unarmed Combat – Strikes, defences, awareness & de-escalation Close-Range Scenarios – Escaping chokes, grabs & holds Ground Survival – Falling safely & getting up fast Knife Defence – Skills for edged-weapon threats Blunt Weapon Defence – Defences vs sticks, bats & improvised weapons Firearm Threats – Survival principles vs pistols & rifles Weekly instructor-led sessions with Master Mohammed, our qualified instructor Fridays 19:30–21:30, Activity Space 1, Beit Quad Wed 1st – Tasters 18:30 & 19:30, Union Gym Wed 8th – First lesson 20:00–21:45, Union Gym Fri 17th – Second lesson 19:30–21:30, Activity Space 1 Fri 24th – Third lesson 19:30–21:30, Activity Space 1 Fri 31st – Fourth lesson 19:30–21:30, Activity Space 1 First session is FREE – Sign up here CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Krishna Consciousness
societies.description: •The Krishna Consciousness Society at Imperial offers a platform to evolve the mind, give direction in life and reveal a deeper level of insight by connecting with like-minded people. The Krishna Consciousness Society is for open minded, deep thinkers who take an interest in spirituality and viewing things from "outside the box". We present eastern philosophy and allow others to share their opinions on them. The Krishna Consciousness Society is about introducing spirituality to students. We aim to reach beyond the boundaries of caste, creed and colour, by establishing the science of the soul, and to help students find spiritual solutions to material problems such as alcoholism, drug abuse, social and academic pressures by promoting simple living and high thinking. We place a greater emphasis on spirituality rather than any particular religion. The society also aims to put students in touch with Eastern spiritual techniques, such as yoga and meditation, so they can apply ancient wisdom to modern life as a student, something that we feel is becoming more popular here in the UK. It also aims to create an non- judgemental, open and safe environment in which students can discuss and ask questions about faith and philosophy without having to belong to any religion or culture. CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Kung Fu
societies.description: Each class is between 1.5-3 hours and is led by an expert instructor in your chosen style. They will teach you a range of techniques from kicks & punches to complex jumping kicks and forms, giving you practical self-defence skills and getting you fighting fit. All of our classes are suited for a range of skill levels from absolute beginner to seasoned fighter, and no experience or equipment is needed to start. CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Lacrosse
societies.description: Lacrosse is the ideal mix of competitive spirit and fun, whether you’re a seasoned athlete or picking up a stick for the first time! We pride ourselves on having one of THE BEST Fresher’s Programmes here, and our success on the field speaks for itself. But Lacrosse is more than just playing; it's about being part of a community. Our weekly Wednesday Sports Nights, stylish Black Tie events, Laxmas Dinner and unforgettable Tours make it easy to balance academia with an active social life.  In fact we have our 1st domestic tour on November 22-24th, which is the best time for everyone to get to know each other! We’re open to all—medics and non-medics, men and women, beginners, and experts alike. Plus, with flexible training sessions you can easily fit them into your schedule: - Tuesday 18:00-20:00 - Men's/ Women’s/ Mixed Training @ Harlington Sports Grounds - Wednesday - BUCS Matches followed by Sports Night - Saturday 10:00-12:00 - Men’s and Women’s Training followed by Mixed Training @ Lillie Park - Sunday - Mixed LUSL games Come give it a try—whether you want to compete or just have fun, our club has something for everyone! And don't forget to check us out on Instagram for continuous updates year long -> @iclaxofficial CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Law
societies.description: Your degree at Imperial not only provides you with many of the transferable skills required for a legal career but also has direct relevance to several practice areas, such as Life Sciences or Intellectual Property. The application process is competitive, but you are not alone. Our Society will help our members through each stage of the journey towards a legal career. We have numerous offline/on-campus events ranging from practice interviews, mock case studies, networking events, and corporate presentations! To join our mailing list and keep up to date with our socials, click HERE. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Lebanese
societies.description: Diverse events will be organised during the year and everyone is invited to attend, discover and have fun! Find us on instagram! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Lifestyle Medicine and Prevention
societies.description: Research  shows  that  health behaviours surrounding nutrition, sleep, exercise, and managing stress levels have a direct  impact  on  delaying  chronic  disease  onset.  Addressing  these  will  help  us  to reduce our reliance on secondary and tertiary healthcare interventions. In LMAP Society we are promoting healthy living among medical students and patients alike  for  a  healthier  NHS. This  year  we’ll  be  hearing  from  leading  clinicians  in  the emerging  field  and  have  the  opportunity  to  learn  easy,  practical  ways  to  lead a healthier lifestyle. Up for a Park Run? Or maybe you’re better in the kitchen – join our IGLives! Whatever you decide, we’re looking forward to meeting you soon! CSP Chair / President
societies.tagline: Welcome to Lifestyle Medicine and Prevention

societies.name: Light Opera (ICSM)
societies.description: During first term, we produce our Main Show, a musical extravaganza, over seven weeks and performed over four nights in December. Previous productions include ‘Curtains’, ‘Pippin’, 'Dirty Rotten Scoundrels', and most recently, 'Legally Blonde'. During third term, we produce our 24-hour Opera - a musical planned in secret and revealed to the cast the day before the performance, so the whole show is prepped in 24 hours! Recent productions include 'Mamma Mia', ‘The Rocky Horror Picture Show’, and ‘Kinky Boots’, with all proceeds going to charity. Light Opera is one of the most active societies within ICSM, organising at least two socials per week in first term. These nights out, along with the annual Opera Tour, will make your first term the best few months of your life! And with events like our annual Opera Dinner during second term, our ‘Big Chills’ (open-mic nights at Reynolds Bar), and ‘UH Revue’ (a sketch show competition with other London medical schools), the rest of your year will be filled with activities! The Light Opera family ranges from complete novices to those who were doing jazz hands in utero, with members spanning all years of ICSM, as well as many non-medic members! For more information on getting involved, find us at Freshers' Fair and follow us on IG: @icsmlightopera CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer
