societies.name: Mahjong
societies.description: Mahjong is one of the oldest Chinese tiles game in which four players play in a game of wits, skill, and luck. We mainly play the Canton/Hong Kong style of Mahjong during our socials, and are looking forward to learning about new styles from our members! to join us for weekly sessions every Friday to play against other club members and discuss game strategies (or anything under the sun). We also host Mahjong tournaments, internal and external, for you to put your skills to the test! Our members can borrow Mahjong sets from us to play at home with your friends and family, so become a Mahjong Society member today! Join us for a year of Mahjong fun! We'll see you at our events and socials :) CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Malayali Society
societies.description: We are all about promoting and showcasing the culture of the state of Kerala in India. With a large expat population in the UK, we strive to bring together students in our university who share our common values, whilst also strongly encouraging anyone who is interested or shares the love for our culture to be a part of our society as well! We run a multitude of events throughout the year, such as our meet and greet, games nights, movie nights and collaborative socials with other societies! So what are you waiting for? Become a member today! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.description: The Maldives Society aims to promote and celebrate Maldivian culture within the Imperial community. We organise socials, cultural events, and outreach activities, while creating opportunities to connect with Maldivian alumni. Whether you’re Maldivian or simply curious to learn more, our society offers a welcoming space to share traditions, build friendships, and strengthen the Maldivian community at Imperial and beyond. It's Marhaba for everyone! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Mathematics
societies.description: Fuelled by curiosity, we bring Maths and JMC students together through events that are as fun as they are inspiring, from football matches and boat parties to hands-on quantitative finance workshops. Proofs, pizza, pals: whether you’re here to socialise, learn, or try something new, there’s something for everyone. Backed by a variety of sponsors across finance, tech, and data science, we host regular workshops, talks, and networking sessions that connect students with cutting-edge ideas and career opportunities in academia, quantitative finance and AI/ML — maths with impact and a bit of flair. This year we’re especially excited about Cauchy Capital, a new student-led quant finance project and collective, giving members a space to collaborate, research, and explore innovative ideas. Find us on Instagram @icmathsoc and check out @cauchycapital to see what they’re up to. Come meet us at the Welcome Fair on 1st October! societies.description: MedTech is the society for you! As a society we aim to provide a collaborative platform for MedTech innovation and Imperial between all students, both medical and non-medical. We strive to promote student participation in MedTech through our speaker and workshops series. Watch out for our annual  we host each year - an unbeatable opportunity to hear from successful and passionate speakers, and connect with like-minded individuals. societies.description: Everyone is welcome, whether you've never heard of mindfulness before or whether you're a seasoned practitioner. It's a totally relaxed, non-judgemental environment - come and join us any time. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Motorsports
societies.description: We compete in the British Universities Karting Championship (BUKC), a national competition which tests us against over 100 other universities in the country. Last year we won the championship! The championship culminates in a 24-hour race during the summer solstice weekend – just like Le Mans. Beginners are equally welcome as we host plenty of karting trips for just our club, renting out rental tracks for our club members to race against each other in a friendly low pressure environment! We also have a VR simulator rig where our top karting drivers regularly practice honing their skills for the karting championship. The rig is open to all experience levels and is a great way to gauge how you stack up against our other members. To check out more of what we do check out our Instagram @imperialmotorclub or website www.motorclubcgcu.co.uk. CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Mountaineering
societies.description: The club is active in all aspects of climbing including bouldering, sport, traditional, winter and beyond. We also represent Imperial in competitions such as BUCS. With a huge pool of experience amongst our members it provides the ideal atmosphere for new climbers to learn and for experienced climbers to progress. Climbing gives a unique and adventurous perspective on life and provides both physical and mental challenges that are uniquely satisfying. The club meets every Wednesday to go climbing at top quality indoor walls in London and every second weekend we run heavily subsidised trips to the best climbing areas in the UK. We run social nights throughout the year and head abroad during the Easter and Summer holidays for tours to areas that have included Croatia, Italy and Spain. In addition there are trips in summer term to Fontainebleau in France and also a winter tour. Sign up at the Freshers' Fair and we looking forward to climbing with you soon! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Muay Thai
societies.description: Whether you want to become a fighter, increase your self-confidence, get fit or improve your physique, Thai Kickboxing is the sport for you. Muay Thai can be practiced by anyone, big or small, male or female. All you need is determination, an open mind and we'll supply the rest. There are three weekly 2h training sessions. Each one is lead by a different qualified trainer, providing a rounded learning experience. Each class is only £3 for members! (£5 for non-members). And if you're not sure if you want to join, just come try a class for free :) We're running sessions on Tuesdays 18:00 to 20:00 in the Union Gym, Wednesdays 16:00 to 18:00 in Activity Spaces 1&2, and Fridays 20:00 to 22:00 in the Union Gym. We also hold many social events throughout the year and participate in inter-club fights in different universities in the UK. Don't hesitate to send us a message with any question you might have! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Music (ICSM)
societies.description: ICSM Music Society encompasses a wide range of ensembles that socialise and rehearse weekly, offering something for musicians of all abilities and personality types! We consist of 5 ensembles: ICSM Orchestra, Choir, Chamber Choir, Jazz Band, and Bands. Each ensemble showcases top notch performances at various locations throughout the year, including local churches, pubs, clubs, and ICSM events. Our current members describe Music Society as "the best thing ever, even better than sliced bread". Musicians of all standards are welcome, medics and non-medics, and with the exception of Chamber Choir, there is no need to audition. We also have our own ICSM Music Scholarship for one Fresher to have free music lessons, and within the first few weeks of term, everyone has the opportunity to sing in the Royal Albert Hall! Every Autumn term, we go on a hugely popular social Weekend Away to escape London. And every other summer, we embark on an International Tour to charm music lovers across the continent with our gigs and concerts, as well as to explore vibrant cities and their rich nightlife. Our next International Tour will be this Summer 2023, with location announced at our upcoming Fresher's Mingle! Our calendar is just PACKED with performances, socials, dinners and tours - come along, and you'll see why we are one of the largest and most active societies that ICSM has to offer. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Musical Theatre
societies.description: Do you love to sing? Got a passion for acting? Can't help but dance when you hear that beat? Musical Theatre Society (MTSoc) has been putting on spectacular shows for over 60 years, and we would love you to join our long tradition! Whether you want to join the cast and be in the spotlight, jump into the pit as part of our incredible band, or bring your ideas to life as a director, choreographer or musical director, you are sure to have a great time with MTSoc! Previous shows include "Legally Blonde", "In The Heights", "Sweeney Todd", "Grease", "The Addams Family" and many more! We have an ever-expanding number of shows including our full scale Spring Show, 24-hour musical, and our annual Revue, alongside great socials, cabarets and workshops, giving you plenty of great ways to get involved. With rehearsals on Sundays, Mondays and Tuesdays, we offer the perfect way to unwind from Imperial life. To find out more about MTSoc, check us out on Facebook & Insta, on our website mtsoc.co.uk, or find us at the Fresher's Fair! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Muslim Medics
societies.description: Assalaamualaykum, and welcome to Muslim Medics!! Since 1998, we have been the go-to society for academic support, wellbeing, and socials for medical students across the year groups. To sum up our work, we are for students, by students- we know first hand the struggles of being a medical student and work to maximise your experience at Imperial and meet your needs. We like to go beyond students at Imperial too- our PotMed stream gives you an opportunity to help those once in your position applying to medical school, and our strong alumni network reunites those once in our shoes. Throughout your time at Imperial, be sure to check out our famous weekly tutorials, revision days and mock examinations! From Freshers to Finals, we're here for you! Want to know more? Check out our website at https://www.muslimmedics.org! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Nepali Society
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Netball
societies.description: As well as weekly matches against other universities, we participate in Imperial Varsity, charity netball tournaments and mixed netball with IC Rugby. Wednesday night at Imperial is Sports Night, so you’ll be welcome to join us as we carry our team spirit off the court and over to the weekly social. There’s no better way to make some good friends and forget about your assignments. This year, we have an international tour and many joint sports socials in the works – great ways to meet new people and blow off some steam. Look out for Halloween socials, Christmas dinner, welcome drinks, and so much more to get involved. Reach out if you’re interested and follow our socials for up-to-date info! CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Netball (ICSM)
societies.description: Whether you’re looking to try a new sport or to develop existing skills, we offer something for everyone! Our 1s-4s compete weekly in BUCS and LUSL leagues, and our Social team compete in a more casual league. On top of that, we train every Sunday afternoon in Fulham under the watchful eye of our wonderful coaches. All 5 teams compete in a nail-biting annual Varsity match too! You can undoubtedly find us having as much a great time off-court as we do on-court. We have sports night every week, team socials, curries, bowling, Christmas dinner and End of Season dinner just to name a few of our amazing events! We also go on two tours a year - International tour and Fetball tour, where we team up with the lovely ICSM Football boys for one of the most entertaining weekends of the year! I know what you’re thinking - how do you keep on top of uni work with all of this going on? Luckily our educational support is second to none, with plenty of tutorials for all year groups covering the topics you want, mock exams, and fantastic tutoring schemes for clinical exams like OSCE and PACES. We can't wait to meet you during freshers fortnight! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Netball (RSM)
societies.description: Training is very relaxed and student led. We have weekly matches across London as part of the London University Sports League (LUSL). All our training and matches are in preparation for the event of the year – BOTTLE MATCH! Bottle is the world's second oldest varsity (according to Wikipedia) culminating in a weekend of fierce sporting rivalry against the Camborne School of Mines. Each year we battle it out on the court against CSM and support our fellow RSM sports clubs in their matches. It is the highlight of the RSM calendar! Not only are we ace on court we love a social too! Whether its catching a Super League game at the Copper Box Arena, pizza nights,  or bowling with the other RSM sport clubs, there will be an event for everyone. If this sounds like the club for you, or you have any questions, then feel free to drop us an email! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Neuro
societies.description: We run a wide variety of events throughout the year. These events include our Speaker Series, Journal Club, Brain Dissections, Volunteer Scheme and much more! We also organise the UK’s largest student-led neuroscience conference, Meeting of the Minds, which was a sell-out event in 2023! This conference promises a series of fascinating talks and interactive workshops conducted by world-class experts. Previous speakers have included neurosurgeon Mr Henry Marsh and computational neuroscientist Prof. Karl Friston. So don’t miss out on becoming part of our brilliant community for only £3 / year! For more details about us and our events, see https://www.icneuroscience.com/ or contact neuro@imperial.ac.uk. CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Neurodiversity
societies.description: We aim to make neurodivergent people and issues more visible and provide support for those experiencing difficulties. We strive to raise awareness of the societal stigma against neurodivergent people, and advocate for policy changes at Imperial. We also aim to support individuals who suspect they may be neurodivergent, throughout their diagnosis journeys. We have a variety of events planned so far including regular discussion groups, guest speaker events, and PowerPoint nights. We also plan to collaborate with other societies and organisations. Join us in our journey to promote understanding, acceptance, and equality for all. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Neurotechnology
societies.description: CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Nordic
societies.description: Our society goes beyond stereotypes, organizing dinners, lectures, and cultural experiences that showcase the vibrant tapestry of Nordic traditions, arts, and history. These events celebrate the unique contributions of the Nordic region to the world. Some examples of what we did last year was Kubb tournaments in Hyde Park, Nordic board game nights, Swedish Christmas concert, of course a pub crawl incorporating some Nordic inspired bars, and an ABBA party with other Nordic societies! Additionally, we foster connections between our members and the Nordic industrial, financial, and professional presence in the UK. By inviting influential Nordic individuals based in the UK, we offer exclusive insights, inspirational talks, and career events with Nordic companies. Building a strong network within and beyond Imperial College is our mission. An example is the careers talk we held with Norway’s Sovereign Wealth fund last year. Have questions or simply want to chat? Find us at our stall during the Freshers' Fair. We can't wait to meet you and welcome you to our vibrant Nordic community. Join us in celebrating the richness and diversity of our Nordic heritage! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Northern Society
societies.description: We aim to create a community for all that’s as friendly and welcoming as the North itself, while widening appreciation of Northern Culture amongst the student body through our themed events. As a member you will be able to participate in our events at a discount or absolutely free. Here’s what we hope to bring you this year: Fortnightly mingles wi brews and biccies – a chance to meet and chat to Imperial’s Northerners. A classic, but Northern. Northern bands, Northern bangers. Get on your dancing shoes! While our primary objectives are to provide our members and the wider college community with a taste of the North, we also aim to promote awareness of the persistent inequality between the North and South of England. CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Nutritank
societies.description: CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Obstetrics & Gynaecology
societies.description: Imperial College Obstetrics and Gynaecology society was originally founded in 2013 and acts as a bridging body to help you through everything O&G related during your time here at Imperial. At the heart of what we do is a strong sense of community that we aim to foster via frequent events throughout the year, ranging from academic to more social. We organise tutorials for Years 1, 2 and 5 as well as mock PACES for our fifth-year students. Reproductive & Developmental Sciences BSc students are offered tutorials, as well as mentors, to help guide them through their coursework and research projects. Innovative talks and seminars are also held each term to raise awareness of important topics in the field such as FGM, postnatal depression and miscarriage. We also provide opportunities for our members to network with O&G professionals in order to support students interested in pursuing specialty training in these niche areas. This year, we held our very first Journal Club which has seen an impressive numbers of students in attendance. Every month, a scientific article proposed by two members of our society is brought forth and discussed, helping to nurture an interest in research for those with a passion in this field. In 2018, we held our first independent undergraduate conference, which continues to be well-attended, drawing in students from universities all over the country. We hope to further expand our reach by making our conference bigger and more impactful every year. Additionally, we host a range of events such as our Welcome Social and collaborative fundraising events with London uni O&G societies to help bring together a community of students with an interest in this specialty. Join our mailing list and follow us on social media (Facebook, Instagram and Twitter) for updated information on all our events and external opportunities! Please get in touch with us by DMing us on social media or via email at obscar@ic.ac.uk! Don't miss out and get your membership NOW! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Oncology
societies.description: The society was founded in April 2013 due to the overwhelming interest in the field of Oncology in Imperial. From year 1, to finals in year 6, oncology is a core component in our medical school and beyond. We hold interesting talks with pioneers in the field of oncology so come along to our inaugural surgical oncology conference as well as our national oncology conference. Unsure about what specialty to choose within oncology? Fear not, we have you covered with our Clinical Specialties Day. Fundraising is a fundamental part of our ethos – follow our Instagram to keep up to find out which charity we have chosen this year as well as our fantastic charity events! For those who are research (and points minded!) we also have research opportunities for our members with affiliated Imperial healthcare researchers. Worried about POM or BRS? Come to our cancer crash course days where we go through every cancer related lecture just before your final exams ? So if you want to get involved in one of the most dynamic societies at Imperial – get your membership today – Our committee CAN’T WAIT to see you at our events and socials throughout the next academic year :D CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.description: CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Orchestra - Sinfonietta
societies.description: Last year's concerts included performances of Kallinikov's Symphony No. 1, Dvorak's Symphony No. 8, and Sibelius' Violin Concerto. We rehearse every Monday at 18.30, followed by a trip to hbar or union - the perfect way to start your week. We have a highly deserved reputation as being a very sociable orchestra, with socials organised throughout the year, and our weekend away in first term is a great ice-breaker for new players! Our fun-loving nature does not detract from our playing, however, and we put on fantastic performances three times a year, with some distinguished young soloists from Imperial. We are also one of the most travelled musical societies, touring yearly to locations such as Valencia, Croatia, Romania, as well as joint tours with ICSO to Prague and most recently Zaragoza and Burgos. We are always on the lookout for new players - no audition is required for strings or percussion, and we have occasional vacancies in woodwind, horns and brass. So if you'd like to be part of one of the most enjoyable and rewarding societies at Imperial, come and find us at Freshers' Fair! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.description: CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Orthopaedics Society
societies.description: We aim to serve as a catalyst for diversity in orthopaedics, cultivating interest among medical and non-medical students alike. Join us for an exiting line-up of events, ranging from career panels, our highly rated teaching series and our Inaugaral Orthopaedic Conference! We bring together orthopaedic specialists, biomedical engineers, and researchers to interact with students, breaking barriers and fostering connections. Our society aims to kickstart careers in orthopaedics by providing unique opportunities for learning, mentorship, and professional development. Join us in shaping a more diverse and inclusive future for orthopaedic medicine! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Outdoor
societies.description: CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Overseas Christian Fellowship
societies.description: At OCF we aim to be a Christ-centered, loving community of international students reaching out to international students, supporting, equipping and challenging each other to grow in spiritual maturity, and to serve God and impact lives where He places us. Our typical Friday evening session meets on campus and consists of worship in song, Bible study and fellowship. We value friendships, food and fun - so do come along and join us whatever your background, nationality or faith may be! Be part of our home away from home - as we journey on towards an enduring and everlasting eternal Home. Contact us via any of our social media pages, using our Linktree: https://linktr.ee/ocflondon and we would be happy to get in touch with you! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Padel
societies.description: Welcome to Imperial College Padel Club, a vibrant and dynamic community dedicated to the exhilarating sport of padel! Our club is a haven for padel enthusiasts of all levels, where beginners and advanced players alike come together to celebrate the greatness of this fantastic game. At ICPC, our mission is clear: to promote padel and provide an inclusive environment where everyone can enjoy the sport to its fullest. We believe that padel is more than just a game—it's an opportunity to connect, compete, and grow both physically and mentally. We welcome beginners and advanced players alike, creating a supportive and inclusive environment for everyone to learn, grow, and excel in their padel journey.  Our club hosts weekly socials where members can unwind, socialise, and forge friendships that extend beyond the court, but also competitive tournaments to showcase your skills and even represent Imperial in inter-university tournaments. These events serve as a reminder that padel is not just about the game, but also about the community and the joy of coming together. Join us at Imperial College Padel Club and discover a world of fun, growth, and connection. Whether you're a beginner looking to learn or an advanced player seeking new challenges, our club is the perfect place to embrace the greatness of padel and unleash your passion for the sport. Come be a part of our dynamic community! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Paediatrics
societies.description: CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Pakistan
societies.description: Our mission is to be a hub of cultural exchange and celebration. Throughout the year, we strive to bring you a diverse range of events that showcase the best of Pakistan. From our mouthwatering Nashta mornings featuring classic Pakistani cuisine and steaming cups of chai, to adrenaline-pumping inter-society sports battles – we've got it all covered! But that's not all. Our calendar is brimming with socials that'll keep the energy and excitement alive. However, the crown jewel of our events is undoubtedly 'SHAAM’, our flagship charity dinner. It's an evening you won't want to miss, where we combine delicious food, cultural performances, and a strong sense of community to make a meaningful impact. After a sold-out dinner last year and stellar performances, we're working hard to make this year's SHAAM even more spectacular, so stay tuned! If you’re a fan of chilled get-togethers, competitive bowling missions and huge laughs, PakSoc is the society for you! Whether you're a homegrown talent or an international student, we're here to welcome you with open arms and a warm cup of chai. To get to know us better, make sure to drop by our booth at the Freshers' Fair – because you definitely don't want to miss out on the incredible journey that awaits you with Pakistan Society! CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Parkour and Gymnastics
societies.description: We believe parkour and freerunning are not just for the daring; they're fun and easy to learn. All skill levels are welcome, and we provide a supportive environment to improve your abilities. Training sessions take place in various London locations and at the Union Gym and are led by qualified coaches. In collaboration with the UCL Gymnastics Society, we offer joint gymnastics training and social events, fostering a vibrant community of like-minded individuals. Here you can connect with passionate members from both societies, make new friends, and share your love for learning new tricks. Our regular gymnastics training takes place at the Talacre Community Sports Centre, a fully equipped facility with apparatus such as the floor, pommel horse, rings, vault, parallel bars, high bar, uneven bars, and beams. Expert coaches ensure your safety and provide comprehensive training for beginners and experienced individuals alike. Whether you aim to compete in parkour, freerunning, or gymnastics, or simply want to learn new skills in a safe environment, the Imperial Parkour and Gymnastics Society is perfect for you. Follow us on Instagram @ic_gymnasts and @ic_parkour to find out more! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: PASS
societies.description: Public Awareness events are held throughout the year for members to explore the world's hot topics and for them to develop their way of thinking. Via discussion forums, debating, public speaking competitions and creating social media campaigns, they can hone their public speaking and presentation skills. Our Social Service activities aim to give our members the opportunity to contribute to society, thus encouraging altruistic behaviour. Past activities include fundraising, helping out at soup kitchens and delivering Maths & English tutoring sessions for the underprivileged. Our flagship event Famine 24 is fully organised by our members, aiming at raising public awareness while raising money for our beneficiaries. At ICPASS, we regularly connect with over 30 other PASS societies in the UK to collaborate on events. We publish a magazine, PASSTIMES, on a quarterly basis. It covers event reviews, editorials, and articles on current affairs, culture, travel and careers. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Pathology
societies.description: This year, we plan to do the following: Make sure to  subscribe to our newsletter  to receive updates on our events! Getting membership will give you access to our events, but does not automatically subscribe you to our newsletter - so make sure to fill out the form if you want to receive updates from us! CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Pharmacology
societies.description: •We provide talks, tutorials and revision series for people possessing an interest in pharmacology and/or the pharmaceutical industry. •Imperial College Pharmacology Society was created to serve as a platform for Imperial students to think, learn and engage in Pharmacology. •We have various activities and events planned throughout the year, ranging from a revision series to help you ace your exams, to exciting and topical talks by guest speakers in both research and industry. •Pharmacology makes up a large proportion of year 2 LCRS exams. We aim to provide you with the best preparation possible for exams. •Whether you are set on finding a cure for cancer through research, keen on pursuing a career in pharmaceuticals, or simply want to learn about the side effects of aspirin for your exams - we are the society for you! •Importantly, we emphasise that students from ANY Imperial College faculty are welcome to join as members - all that is required is a curiosity and interest in pharmacology! •Our 3 key aims are as follows: 1. Revision series and tutorials for junior medical students, led by older years, to help develop a solid understanding of the syllabus and integrate this into their future clinical careers. 2. Cutting-edge talks by renowned speakers from medical, pharmaceutical and research backgrounds, aimed at cultivating interest in pharm careers or research among medical, science and business students! 3. Demystify pharmacology as a dull and complex topic! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Philosophy
societies.description: We are a gathering of curious minds, meeting weekly to explore and challenge a vast landscape of ideas. From the nature of reality to the ethics of artificial intelligence, we are always open to suggestions and no topic is too grand or too obscure for our discussions. If you’re looking for a space to engage with profound ideas and like-minded individuals, we invite you to join us. Who knows? You might just find more questions than you started with—and that’s exactly the point. While answers are not always guaranteed, fun and stimulating conversations are, and for those who fancy: so is a trip to the pub! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Photosoc
societies.description: Every week we head off to an interesting part of London to take photos or visit an exhibition in some of London's many galleries. Every term we run a comprehensive series of tutorials on camera technique and darkroom technique. As well as providing a meeting place for those passionate about photography. We also provide a fully equipped darkroom, media hub for editing photos and loan out equipment. More information can be found at our website below, or you can also find us on facebook at ICU Photosoc. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Physics
societies.description: The Physics Society offers a wide range of free events to all who study or are interested in this beautiful science. Join us for captivating guest lectures with world-renowned physicists, tours in the laboratories at the forefront of knowledge, career opportunities with some of the most prominent companies and - of course - socials and pizza parties. You will also have the chance to represent the physics department and Imperial College at inter-departmental or inter-university events and competitions. The physics community forges lifelong social and professional relationships with other students and academics and makes your time at university unforgettable so don't hesitate to come to one of our events! Get ready for the start of term with the new PhySoc Autumn Collection! Your PhySoc committee 2024/25 CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Pilots
societies.description: We are offering extremely discounted flying experiences from a few flying clubs in London, industry visits to places such as the AAIB, British Airways, opportunities to come along on our fly-outs to destinations like Cambridge, Duxford, Isle of Wight, Brighton and even abroad to the continent, as well as help and guidance with the theoretical side of flying. If you already have a licence, then joining is a no-brainer as we'll massively help cut your cost thanks to cost sharing and aircraft hire subsidies! Whether you have a passion for flight and want to try it first-hand, or you've logged 500+ hours as Pilot-in-Command, you will never have the opportunity to fly an aircraft for so cheap. So come and join us at Freshers' Fair - we're looking forward to meeting you! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Pint of Science
societies.description: The 2016 festival takes place over three days (23rd-25th May) simultaneously in pubs across nine countries! Here at Imperial, top academics from Imperial will talk about the research they are undertaking in five simultaneous events at different pubs in the West London area covering Beautiful Mind, Our Body, Planet Earth, Atoms to Galaxies and Tech me Out. CSP Chair / President

societies.description: Stay connected with iPRAS for the latest updates by following our Instagram account @icplasticsurg and exploring our Linktree at www.linktr.ee/iPRAS. societies.name: Poetry
societies.description: We hold Open Mics termly, update our Discord and Instagram with inspiration and discussion topics, and generally foster a friendly and chill community. We also publish an anthology annually to showcase the creativity that thrives in a STEM university! If you've never shared your poetry in an Open Mic before, don't worry - It's pretty low pressure round here, and many of us had never done it either before joining :) Check out our social media and sign up to our mailing list (https://linktr.ee/icpoet). See you soon! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Pokemon
societies.description: Anime intro references aside, ICPokéSoc strives to be a place for every gamer: from the hardcore, competitive gamer, to the plushie-loving casual fan. We hope to be a welcoming environment for everyone interested in the world of gaming.. and especially in the wonderful world of Pokémon! As a result, we host a variety of events, including market crawls, inter-uni tourneys, official event meet-ups, art-and-crafts sessions, and more! So grab our free membership to join our community! We hope to see you soon! Find out more about ICon! CSP Chair / President

societies.description: Do you enjoy East Asian Pop music? Are you a musician or an eager audience member? Then PEASOC (Pop of East Asia) is perfect for you! We do weekly alternating more formal band practices and casual jams of (mostly) East Asian Pop music (Cantopop, J-pop, Chinese pop, etc.) Each member can put forward songs of their choice and we will do the songs by rotation. Throughout the year, we have also planned some socials and collaborations with other societies. After getting the free membership, please join our discord server. We hope to see you soon!!
