societies.name: Prototyping and Hacking Society
societies.description: Although we are new and just getting started, we firmly believe that everyone has something valuable to contribute. At ProtoSoc, we're passionate about fostering a supportive community where members can help each other learn, grow, and achieve their goals.Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, ProtoSoc welcomes students of all skill levels. Our mission is to provide a platform for collaboration, exploration, and hands-on learning. With access to cutting-edge machines such as 3D printers, laser cutters, and CAD software, we're equipped to turn our ideas into reality. Join us in exciting ventures ranging from crafting small wooden pieces to brainstorming solutions for global challenges. Our diverse community of curious minds is dedicated to exploring the myriad machines and tools available at Hackspace, turning ideas into reality. If you're seeking a supportive environment where you can learn, collaborate, and grow, then ProtoSoc is the perfect fit for you. Join our community today and let's embark on this thrilling journey of exploration and discovery together! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer
societies.tagline: Welcome to Prototyping and Hacking Society

societies.name: Psychiatry
societies.description: In addition to our cross-cultural, interdisciplinary events throughout the year, we are also excited to present you with some fantastic mentoring and volunteering schemes! With PsychStart, you can get paired with a psychiatrist and see whether psychiatry is a career for you; or if you'd prefer to volunteer, you can join our sister scheme, OpenMinds, and deliver mental health teaching in schools! For all this and more, be sure to get membership for discounted tickets to our all our events throughout the year! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Public Speaking
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Punjabi
societies.description: Our aim is to provide a space for people of all backgrounds to come together and enjoy the many aspects of Punjabi culture. Whether it’s the food, or the dance, or anything in between, we are proud of our heritage and want to share it with you. The events held range from Gupshup, a welcome dinner during freshers to give you a taste of our home, to Movie Nights to give you that true Punjabi feel (there are subtitles, don’t worry), to Bhangra classes, where you can learn to dance to the epic beat of a dhol drum. We also organise, present, and compete in the largest student show in the country: The Bhangra Showdown, where dancers from university teams all over the UK compete against one another to be crowned champions on stage in front of thousands of fans. Above all, we want to build a community, not of Punjabi people, but of people who appreciate everything Punjab has to give; and if you feel you don’t belong because you’re not Punjabi enough, take it from us, you are! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Quiz
societies.description: We're the home for quizzing at Imperial - whether you're after a place on the University Challenge team, enjoy winning the pub quiz or you want to learn new things and find friends. So join the society to be kept in the know for all the events coming up this year! (We couldn't add it to the links below but you can follow us on BlueSky too) CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Racing
societies.description: Shell Eco-Marathon is an international competition where you compete for energy efficiency by designing a single seater light-weight car. Formula Student is an international event in which engineering students from the world's top technical universities' compete in the design and manufacture of an open-wheel single-seater racing car. Last year Imperial Eco-Marathon went to competition to France, and is planning to do so again this year. The formula student team will also be aiming to reach Silverstone this year. The club principally consists of third and fourth year Mechanical Engineering students who build the cars as part of their major projects, however, the club is open to anyone with an enthusiasm for engineering and racing. There are also plenty of opportunities for first and second years to get involved with the manufacture of components, fundraising, administration and even having a drive! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Radio
societies.description: IC Radio is among the oldest student radio stations in the country. Started in 1976, broadcasting on a home built AM transmitter around halls, we now broadcast all over the globe from icradio.com. Absolutely anyone is welcome to try their hand at presenting or producing a show; whatever your music taste. We also love a good speech based program, so anyone will feel at home in IC Radio. As well as being able to broadcast, we are lucky enough to have a brand new, fully equipped recording studio which we use to record bands and musicians. Behind the scenes we rely on our fantastic technical, musical and promotional teams. Are you interested in web design? Want to record professional band and artists? Maybe you fancy running our IT system? There's a place for you here and we'd love for you to join us! Make sure to follow us on our socials CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Radiology Society
societies.description: We'll be hosting a range of events, including tutorials relevant to common radiological presentations delivered by experienced consultants and registrars, careers talks, interactive demos and networking sessions, as well as interest talks in hot-button issues in the field such as promoting gender equality and whether interventional radiology should be its own specialty. Come along and get to know our team and other aspiring radiologists! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: RAG
societies.description: Our website: www.imperialrag.org CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: RAG (ICSM)
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Rail and Transport
societies.description: At Imperial College Rail and Transport Society (ICRTS), we are committed to providing unique and captivating transport-themed events and bringing people closer together by connecting with other societies and professionals. Throughout the year, you will enjoy exciting opportunities to: Our annual volunteer weekend at the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway is a once-in-a-lifetime experience you cannot miss, getting hands-on engineering experience maintaining a working railway and establishing close ties with veterans of the transport community. You will also get to see the rich history of the railway and the breathtaking scenery of the Welsh Highlands. The ICRTS offers exclusive front-line access to the industry, which will be invaluable to anyone thinking of a future career in this field, or anyone who has any interest in planes/trains/buses/ships. If you are keen to gain insight into the vibrant and growing transport sector or simply have a passion for transport and travel, then the ICRTS is for you! Please visit our website for more information. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: RCS Motor Club
societies.description: If you're inclined to get up to your elbows in oil then you're more than welcome to help with repairs - you don't need to be mechanically minded, experienced or even skilled to help, simply turn up at the garage and we'll show you the ropes! Whether it's joyriding and exploring, greasing and oiling, camping and traveling or just generally making merry out and about in London, drop us an email or follow the sound of Jez's bell - I promise you won't regret it! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Remote Medicine Society
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Respiratory Medicine
societies.description: CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Riding & Polo
societies.description: On top of weekly training, we host several events throughout the year popular with all our members, including Christmas Pony Games, trips to equestrian events like Olympia Horse Show, Badminton Horse Trials, Royal Ascot, and plenty of dinner and bar socials too! We are also already planning another Easter weekend tour riding on the beaches of Portugal. Come and visit us at Freshers' Fair, or ask us questions via email or social media! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Rifle & Pistol
societies.description: We shoot every Wednesday and some Saturdays at our indoor range based in the City. Built in 2013, it is one of the nicest ranges in London and caters to 25 yd smallbore target rifle, gallery rifle, and 10 m air pistol. The range has a clubroom with wi-fi, making it a great place to socialise after shooting, and is also fully accessible. Trips to the National Shooting Centre, Bisley, occur 2-3 times a term, giving members the opportunity to shoot fullbore at distances from 100 to 1000 yards. We also regularly run clays trips to nearby grounds where members can enjoy English Sporting Clays. We have now run two successful tours to Jersey as guests of the Jersey Pistol Club and aim to continue this. Every year, we enter several teams and individuals into BUCS Clays, Fullbore, and Smallbore, where we have always excelled and even won in the past. The club can train you to a high standard and has all the equipment for you to use! We welcome beginners to experienced shooters, so come and give it a go! Mailing list: linktr.ee/icrifleandpistol CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Right to Play
societies.description: CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Robotics
societies.description: Imperial College Robotics Society (ICRS) ICRS is Imperial’s home for robotics, making, and creative engineering. We provide a dedicated lab space (EEE 505) where students can design, prototype, and experiment with their own projects. With 3D printers, a laser cutter, soldering stations, and access to components, the lab is set up for everything from quick prototypes to ambitious builds.Whether you’re completely new to robotics or already working on complex projects, ICRS is a place to learn new skills, work on exciting ideas, and be part of a supportive community of makers. Make – Use our hackspace to build whatever you can imagine. ICRS members can get unlimited free 3D printing with a Lab Pass! Learn – Take part in workshops and courses, including our popular Robotics 101! Compete – Join one of our project teams and represent ICRS in competitions like the European Rover Challenge or battle bots, or take part in our internal robotics contests. Hackathons – Create a team and build an incredible project over a weekend at one of our hackathons. Connect – Meet like-minded makers at talks, socials, and around in the lab! New to Imperial? This is the perfect time to get involved. Drop into the lab to see what’s happening, join our Discord to meet the community, and sign up early for Robotics 101 — no prior experience needed. The best way to get started is by joining our Discord, where we post lab updates, events, and project ideas: CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Robotics Academy
societies.description: Membership is open to students from any faculty (not just engineering) and everyone is welcome. No prior experience in programming or robotics is required. If you have any questions, contact us at RoboticsAcademy@imperial.ac.uk CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Romanian
societies.description: Whether you are Elena Gheorghe’s #1 fan or are yet to become one, whether you already speak Romanian or would just like to learn more about our culture, you are more than welcome to join! ICRoSoc's main aim is to create a familiar atmosphere and to organise and promote cultural, social and professional events within London, contributing to the students' experience throughout University. To make sure you are the first to know about our upcoming events, follow our Instagram page and join our WhatsApp chat! Our plans for this year include, but are not limited to, social meetups, joint events with Romanian societies from other London universities, folk dance classes and celebrations of Romanian holidays such as December 1st and Mărțișor! Therefore, if you are searching for a home-away-from-home or are just looking to meet fellow fans of Elena Gheorghe, you have come to the right place! Join our society and discover Romania’s warm hospitality and unique culture! CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Rugby - Mens
societies.description: If you’re a new Imperial student (undergraduate or postgraduate), get in touch via email or Instagram and we’ll let you know all the information you need to get started. We have training sessions, run by our two coaches, on Monday nights at Old Deer Park in Richmond, home of ex-Premiership London Welsh RFC. We play matches on Wednesday afternoons, with our home ground being Imperial’s Harlington Sports Ground. Forwards are also invited to attend dedicated lineout sessions on Tuesday mornings before lectures near campus. Our three teams cater for all abilities and availabilities; our 1XV compete in the BUCS South Eastern 2nd Tier, with the 2XV and 3XV playing in the 3rd and 5th Tier respectively. Both our 1XV and 2XV were battling for promotion but missed out by a single result, however both teams had an unbeaten cup run, with the 1XV winning the South Eastern Conference Cup. Teams aren’t ringfenced, so every week there’s opportunity to move between teams. Every Wednesday evening, our two social secs cook up a variety of fun and interesting socials, with promised crossovers with a range of Netball clubs. Expect silly games, drinks and lots of laughs, without the culture that gives university rugby teams their usual reputation. The club has two major annual varsity matches: one against Imperial Medics and the other against LSE in The City Varsity. These exciting showcase events are the highlight of the season, both for spectators and players, and are a fantastic opportunity to be part of something special. The City Varsity, organized by our club, has become a highly anticipated event in recent years, and last year raised over £2200 for the Matt Hampson Foundation, while drawing in hundreds of spectators. For more details, visit our website: www.thecityvarsity.co.uk. CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Rugby - Mens (Imperial Medicals)
societies.description: Our club traces its roots back to 1865, where the first of our constituent members, St Marys Hospital RFC was formed. In 1874, they played in the first ever United Hospitals Cup - the oldest rugby cup competition in the world, and one of the first ever official competitions to be played with 15 players on each side. IMRFC has two performance teams, the 1st XV playing in BUCS South East 2B and the 2nd XV playing in BUCS South East 4B. We also have provision for development of new players, who aren't quite comfortable playing a full game yet. We train twice a week, on Mondays and Saturdays, and we play our BUCS fixtures on Wednesdays, followed by a social at the Reynolds Bar. Follow us on Instagram @icsmrugby for regular updates, training times and social information. CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Rugby - Womens
societies.description: Rugby is easy to pick up and play without any previous experience. In fact, most of the squad had never played rugby before coming to Imperial! Matches are played on Wednesday afternoons, with training on Tuesday and Thursday evenings. And in 2022/23 we were Imperial's Team of the Year!! We excel both on and off the pitch as a famously sociable and friendly bunch. Our weekly socials include pubs, games, dinners and amazing fancy dress. We also love to tour and usually put on 2 very affordable tours every year (some as cheap as £20 for the whole weekend!). Past tours include Paris, Southampton, Cardiff, Seville and Vienna. We're a friendly, diverse crowd so whether you're looking to try a new, engaging sport with a great group of people or if you're a more experienced player, ICUWRFC is the place for you! Feel free to message our Instagram or send us an email if you have any more questions CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Russian Speaking
societies.description: We aim to cater to both native Russian speakers, as well as to promote inclusiveness for students interested in the language and a diverse culture of Russian-speaking world, through a range of activities including social events, industry networking events, sport games and many more. Facebook: Imperial College Russian Speaking Society Email: russian@imperial.ac.uk CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Sailing
societies.description: Last year the Imperial team competed at BUSA, getting two teams into Finals, as well as attending competitions in the London area and at Oxford, Cambridge, Reading and other universities. We sail at the renowned Queen Mary Reservoir, known for its high level sailing, offering us the opportunity to train alongside other experienced alumni teams! All members have access to club boats so you can sail whenever you want, should you want to escape the busy London life once a while. Furthermore, we host Summer Sail Week, our annual trip where we rent yachts and sail around either Greece or Croatia for a week. This year we will be visiting the Saronic Gulf, between the 7th and 14th of September. Tickets sell out extremely fast so keep your ears peeled for more information regarding the trip! If experience is anything to go by, it is not a trip to be missed. So, if you want to learn or improve, compete at universities over the country, be part of a team, escape central London and make lots of new friends then this is the club for you. Contact us on sailing@ic.ac.uk or message us on Instagram or href="https://www.facebook.com/imperialcollegesailing/">Facebook to find out more! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Saudi
societies.description: Our Vision: to support members to meet their full potential and make a positive impact within their own lives and communities. Our Mission: to excel in carrying out our responsibilities by offering academic and social tools to enrich members' experience. 1) Support Imperial's current and prospective students and liaise with alumni. 2) Integrate with societies in and outside imperial. 3) Promote a positive recognition of the advancement of Saudi Arabia in science and technology; as well, showcase Saudi culture and values to other international societies. 4) Inspire the society members towards sustaining a positive life balance throughout organizing beneficial courses/ talks and sporting activities. CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Science Fiction and Fantasy
societies.description: Join our WhatsApp group and Discord Server, and follow us on Instagram @imperial_scifi for details & announcements. We run our own lending library, open weekday lunchtimes and plenty of other times besides, which also functions as a social space with a TV/Blu-ray player. Our collection contains 10,000 books, 3000+ DVDs and 600+ graphic novels and counting, and is always expanding by member requests, so if we don't have something you're interested in, join up and tell us all about how fantastic it is, and we'll probably get it! But that isn't all we do - we're a very friendly and social club, with regular video showings as well as many social events outside our beloved library: subsidised cinema trips and convention tickets, seasonal events for Halloween & Christmas, as well as bar nights & bookshop crawls. In February we run Picocon, our annual convention showcasing guest authors, book sales, special events and games. We also have our own fanzine, Wyrmtongue, with creative works submitted by our members. CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer
societies.tagline: Welcome to Science Fiction and Fantasy

societies.name: SCUBA (Underwater) Club
societies.description: We are a BSAC (British Sub-Aqua Club) branch, so we can teach you BSAC’s internationally recognised diver qualifications. All our instructors are (qualified!) volunteers and we own mountains of kit for hire (and three beautiful boats), so our courses are a fraction the cost of training elsewhere! We offer training to all skills levels, from beginner right through to technical training. We also welcome divers with non-BSAC qualifications to cross over and continue to learn with us! In addition to all this, we encourage extracurricular courses such as learning how to drive our club boats, Wreck Appreciation qualifications and Seasearch courses for UK Marine life surveying! With trips running most weekends through summer to a variety of UK dive hot spots (Portland, Farne Islands, Plymouth...), a week long training trip to Cornwall in Easter and annual summer tours (previously Costa Brava, Croatia, Lanzarote, and this year Malta!) you will definitely get your underwater fix with us! Our club calendar lists all of our upcoming trips, courses and socials. We meet at the bar in Beit Quad on Tuesdays around 7pm so come say hi! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Sea Shanty
societies.description: Sea Shanty society is Imperial's premier society for pirate enthusiasts, sea shanty fans, those who enjoy singing but wish not to be in the choir, or sea shantying pirates who wish not to be in the choir! We be having no audition process and no deadlines. We only provide the classic shanties and a lovely Crew of shipmates to sing them with. Our classic weekly meetups see us practicing our favourite shanties and always trying something new. We also occasionally set sail for other socials, such as a boarding of the Golden Hinde. Whether you can barely hold a tune or you can belt symphonies from atop the rigging, all are welcome at Sea Shanty Society! A choir for people who can't sing, for a relaxing end to your day. CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Sexpression
societies.description: Joining this society is a great opportunity for you to gain INVALUABLE teaching experience that will improve your communication skills and help make a difference to the way that sex education is taught in the UK. ALL the training you need is provided by us – no prior knowledge required! In addition to workshops, Sexpression runs events regarding sexual health and wellbeing -check out our social medias for details! JOIN OUR MAILING LIST FOR UPDATES!: tinyurl.com/sexpressionICL CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Shorinji Kempo
societies.description: Every week we learn both striking (punches, kicks, hits to pressure points) and throwing techniques (grab release, takedowns, etc.). We practice in a variety of forms: single-form, pair-form, free-form sparring, and choreographed movements (kata or embu). We also meditate every session. We are part of the British Shorinji Kempo Federation (BSKF). Join us to be part of the friendly, close-knit, and supportive UK Kempo community and make great friends! We are part of the British Shorinji Kempo Federation (BSKF). Join us to be part of the friendly, close-knit, and supportive UK Kempo community and make great friends! We heavily encourage you to connect with the BSKF community, so we subsidise 50% of the cost of your first grading regardless of the outcome! We are very beginner-friendly and welcoming - simply show up at our training in comfortable clothes, and you're good to go! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Sign Language
societies.description: Imperial College Sign Language Society is committed to raising more awareness about BSL with students and bridging the gap between the Deaf and hearing communities. We have 2 hour meetings on Thursdays, with more information on Instagram! We also host a range of events; from theatre visits, to interUni collabs, to attending City Lit Deaf Day. Become a member today to learn to sign and join in on all the fun! We hope to see you soon! CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Sikh
societies.description: We are here to share the teachings of Sikhi and make your university experience more enriching and enjoyable. Our society offers a supportive and friendly environment, providing an excellent opportunity to connect with new people through a variety of events. In collaboration with the Nishaan organization, we also host inter-university events, giving you a chance to network with students across London. These include Games Nights, Kirtan Darbaars, Ice-Skating, and much more! Whether you're Sikh or from another background, everyone is welcome to join our society. We wish you an exciting year ahead and can't wait to meet you at our introductory Meet & Greet event. Come sign up at the Freshers Fair and become part of our community! Vaheguru Ji Ka Khalsa, Vaheguru Ji Ki Fateh! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Singapore
societies.description: Imperial College Singapore Society (ICSS) has a range of social events, sports and lots of fun-filled activities for you to enjoy, be it to get together with your fellow Singaporeans or to celebrate events that you would normally have in Singapore. From enjoying delicious food, to celebrating our multi-cultural society, to forming life-long friendships, ICSS has a place for everyone wanting to celebrate and embrace being Singaporean. For our non-Singaporean friends, we also welcome you to discover more about what being Singaporean means to us. There is something for everyone and ICSS hopes to provide you with a feeling that you’re still enjoying that Singaporean air, while being over 10,000 km away, giving you a ‘Home away from Home’. Check out our social media pages above! For more info, do check out our linktree here and join our telegram channels: linktr.ee/icsingsoc Buy your membership now to sign up for a taste of anything Singaporean! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Skate Society
societies.description: The club for skaters from beginner to pro - roller hockey, slalom, ice, indoor and outdoor. SkateSoc is Imperial's club for roller-skaters and ice-skaters, both beginner and expert. We can teach people to skate up to almost any level, including slalom, hockey, jumps, slides, speed and figure skating. We can get you to the standard to join lots of other skaters on the famous London (easy) Saturday Skate, Sunday Stroll or Friday Night Skate as well as our socials that include roller and ice-discos! The club has skates for you to borrow in most sizes and can supply pads and roller hockey equipment so you don't need to buy your own straight away. We regularly have fun and casual roller hockey matches between members, slalom sessions and short skates around central London. For keen beans, we also compete abroad in the famous Le Mans 24h Roller annually. Our weekly roller skating session takes place outdoors in front of the Albert Memorial in Hyde Park - right next to the union and brilliant all year round. We meet at Beit Quad every Wednesday at 1pm for roller skating and at 1pm at Queens Skate Ice Rink for ice skating. If you've never skated before you are especially welcome! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Skydiving
societies.description: We are here to get you involved in one of the most exciting sports you will ever have the chance of doing at Imperial. Do you think you have the courage to jump from an aircraft 15,000 feet high, grinning as you perform acrobatics at a speed of 120mph? Are you interested in learning how to control the flow of air past your body so you can fly yourself like a free bird? If so, join us on the adventure of a lifetime, skydiving around the UK, the world, and much more! CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Snooker & Pool
societies.description: Great socials, great people, and great potting! Whether you're completely new to cue sports or an experienced player, our club welcomes everyone. We have two full-size, top-quality snooker tables available for members to play from 9am to 11pm everyday, including weekends and throughout the Summer.Our club offers so much more than just access to snooker tables. We host fortnightly socials, including American/English pool events, and fun snooker competitions like shootouts, doubles, and 6 reds. We also run pool training sessions every Monday evening for American 9 ball and English 8 ball, and snooker training every Thursday evening, with guidance from our qualified WPBSA coach.For those looking to compete, we offer the chance to represent Imperial at university-level tournaments, with generous subsidies. We are currently one of the top performing university cue sports clubs in the country, winning BUCS Snooker Championships (nationals) in 2024 and 2025! You can also get involved in internal competitions like the Imperial Snooker Championships and the Imperial Masters, showcasing your skills against fellow members. Outside of cue sports, our club organises a variety of fun activities such as pub crawls, pizza nights, bowling, and mini-golf.All of this comes with a yearly membership fee of just £30, with no additional playing fees - a steal, given that table hire in London is normally £15/hour!With such incredible value, great events, and a welcoming community, there’s never been a better time to join! Join the WhatsApp group chat here: https://chat.whatsapp.com/KXCidd6AAFAJCeqqAFF5jX CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Snowsports
societies.description: CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Society of Research and Academia
societies.description: We are here to develop a network of students interested and passionate about biomedical research and academic medicine, promote student participation in research throughout all years of your studies, and help you build your CV for your future career. Our key events include: For the academic year of 2024/25, we have much more lined up, so stay up to date with what we are up to via our Instagram page and mailing list (linktr.ee/ism.sora)! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer
societies.tagline: Welcome to Society of Research and Academia

societies.name: Somali Society
societies.description: Welcome to Imperial Somali Society, a newly-founded home for those who are Somali or interested in learning and celebrating the Somali culture! This year, we plan to bring SomSoc to life with events to introduce you to fellow Somali students, keep you in contact with people to support you during your time at uni and get to learn more about our people and culture. We hope to see you there! We are committed to forming a presence at Imperial, forming a family-like community that focuses on helping our newest students settle into life at uni, as well as reigniting our love for our background and keeping in touch with our roots. Follow our social media to keep up with our future events! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Soup Run
societies.description: One hundred homeless people benefit from our help every week. In addition to distributing food and hot beverages to those in need, we also have friendly, non-judgemental conversations with them when we talk about anything and everything. In some cases you may be the first person they've talked to for a whole day! Soup Run is much more than just giving out material things - we meet and interact with a variety of people in need that range from rough sleepers to people who have lost their job or are victims of broken home. We believe it is a valuable experience through which you will gain many life-skills while also having the opportunity to meet genuine people from Imperial with the same values who enjoy volunteering in a relaxed, friendly and fun environment, and knowing you have made a real difference in many people's lives. We are part of the London Soup Run Forum and give hot meals out on Sundays in Lincoln's Inn Fields (near Holborn). Joining our society is free and no commitment is required - feel free to attend when you have the time for a worthwhile break and want to join us for a good cause! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: South Asian Society
societies.description: We will start the year out with our 'Meet and Greet' in which students can meet our committee as well as other students. Our bowling, crazy golf and games nights will allow you to get to know new people and get into the competitive spirit, whilst our shisha nights and dinner gatherings are the perfect ways to unwind after stressful days. In South Asian Society we want to create a 'home from home'; our 'Asoc families' scheme will give you the opportunity to meet like-minded students from different years with whom you can form close friendships. If you are interested in learning more about South Asian culture, our informative talks and enlightening social media posts will give you the opportunity to educate yourself, whilst our debates will allow you to express your own opinions and appreciate the opinions of others. We look forward to seeing all of you at Freshers Fair this year and welcoming you into our vibrant community! Follow our instagram @ic.asoc to keep up with our latest news and updates! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Southern African Society
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Space Society
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Spanish
societies.description: It is our gusto, as the official Spanish Society at Imperial College, to welcome you to a close-knit community of Spanish (and Spanish-speaking) students, as well as the main hub of Spanish culture promotion amongst all other students. We enjoy living Spanish culture along the lines of its founding values; familiarity, solidarity and determined optimism. With activities ranging from organised Reggaeton club outings, to Tapas nights, from an intra-societal football league to Mus tournaments, we offer a myriad of activities to reflect how diverse the Spanish culture is. This year, we will also have the opportunity of attending cultural, social and gastronomical events by Spanish artists and personalities across London, and we will arrange informative talks with distinguished companies and personalities. We are here to make you feel at home, be it on a Sunday during a LaLiga match, or whilst you enjoy learning how to make tortilla de patata (con o sin cebolla?). CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Sports & Exercise Medicine
societies.description: Contact us at: semsoc@ic.ac.uk Find out more on our Instagram: @icsm_semsoc CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Sports (Silwood)
societies.description: No description available

societies.name: Squash
societies.description: The club has access to two courts at Ethos, South Kensington, only a 2 minute walk away from uni. We offer coaching to all levels from beginners to county standard players. We also offer courts on weekends and some weekdays to have a hit with your fellow squashers. For the competitively inclined, the club has 3 Men's teams and 2 Women's teams which successfully compete in the top LUSL and BUCS leagues. As one of the biggest social clubs at Imperial we hold a large range of subsidised events such as bar nights, ice skating, joint pub crawls, booze bowling and just general Union fun. So whether you're the next Nick Matthews, an enthusiastic county player, a beginner or you've never picked up a squash racket in your life, the squash club is definitely the club to join CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Squash (ICSM)
societies.description: As the only medical school in London with its own squash club, we take pride in our rich tradition and vibrant community. We practice multiple times a week at Ethos Sports Centre and Charing Cross Sports Centre, conveniently located near the Charing Cross campus. Our sessions are tailored to fit the demanding schedules of medical students, ensuring you can balance both your academic and athletic pursuits. Whether you’re a complete beginner or a seasoned pro, we have specialized training sessions and drills to match your ability. For those with a competitive edge, we field two Men’s teams and a Women’s team in the LUSL leagues, competing on Monday evenings. But squash at ICSM is more than just a sport—it’s a social hub. From curry nights to themed pub crawls, our lively social events foster a friendly and inclusive atmosphere. This year, you can expect to find us in every Sports night at Reynolds, so come say hi! While we are proud to be a medics’ squash club, we warmly welcome non-medics as well. Our members come from all standards and across the entire university. To make squash accessible to everyone, we provide the appropriate shoes and rackets for our members. You are also welcomed to bring your own equipment! Join us not just for the game, but for the camaraderie and support. At ICSM Squash, you’ll find a family that helps you excel both on the court and in your studies.

societies.name: Sri Lankan
societies.description: A close-knit family more than a “society”, the IC Sri Lankan Society was founded over 30 years ago. We are one of the oldest, most successful of all societies, managing the 2nd largest budget at Imperial College Union. Our goal is to bring the vibrancy, diversity & warmth of Sri Lankan culture to Imperial, and to the UK. Our flagship event “Sapphire” (fb.com/ICsapphire) is the largest Lankan event in the UK! A dinner dance that attracts over 1000 guests from across the country to enjoy authentic Sri Lankan food, the hottest Sri Lankan entertainment, & the company of all your friends across the country. We have raised £75,000 since our inception for charities uplifting Sri Lanka including aiding children in the Northern Province gain access to clean drinking water as well as helping restore eyesight to 1000s through cataract operations. By contributing to Sapphire 2022s success, not only will you help raise an invaluable contribution to philanthropic ventures back home, but you will develop a skill set that is in short supply & in high demand. Our celebration of Lankan culture extends throughout the year; from the Warwick University Cricket Tournament and our Christmas & Avurudhu meals! We look forward to seeing you at our baila-jam sessions, our weekly meetings, & our “compulsory” Nandos post-meetings too! CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: STEM Muslims Society
societies.description: We're a network of Muslim STEM students at Imperial, dedicated to academic and professional growth while fostering a strong, values-driven community rooted in Islam — shaping the leaders of tomorrow. Careers Fairs, Hackathons, Exciting Speaker Talks, Networking - we do everything, everyone is welcome to join us and we hope to support you through your academic and career journey and help you achieve success in your goals. We collaborate with so many universities and societies and have many link with many different companies IN SO MANY SECTORS! Our Outreach events are second-to-none, our tutorials are delivered by our amazing group of Academic Reps for each subject and our lineup for our speaker and career events is thrilling. Join us and take part in our events and competitions! There's always loads to do. All of our events are free! [https://linktr.ee/stem.muslims] CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: String Ensemble
societies.description: Imperial College String Ensemble is dedicated to performing the extensive and diverse repertoire composed just for strings. Our musical director is Chris Braime, who helped found the society back in 2004 from talented string players who wanted the more intimate experience of a string ensemble. As Imperial College's only ensemble just for string players, we offer a very different experience to the symphony orchestras. Rehearsals are relaxed with light refreshments, but the music is always fun and challenging and every member has the chance to make a difference. We perform at the end of each term in the local area, as well as organising social days for the players to get to know each other. Rehearsals are held on Friday evenings, with the group going for dinner afterwards. Our rehearsals start from 6pm (baton down at 6.15) on every Friday, usually in the Great Hall, but venues may change week to week. If you're interested in making yourself heard as a string player, why don't you join us? Drop us an email at icse@ic.ac.uk if you have any queries! Or join our mailing list: https://mailman.ic.ac.uk/mailman/listinfo/icse-talk CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Students for Global Health
societies.description: We work with national and international teams to create policies about the topics we are passionate about, whether it be mental health, access to medicines or climate change. There are opportunities to work with government departments, attend international conferences and attend the World Health Assembly. Working closely with allied organisations, we work to raise awareness and create change in the topics we are passionate about. This can include anything from petitions to fundraisers to direct actions in front of Parliament! We run educational events to teach people what global health is and more about current affairs within the field. We also work to transform the medical curriculum to include global health to a greater extent. It is all well and good wanting to change the world but you need to know how! Here at Students for Global Health Imperial we want to build your capacity in key skills you will need to make true change. Through local and national courses, we provide you with the practical skills to do just that. There are plenty of opportunities to meet academics or other like-minded students and carry out research that interests you. Some projects in the past have included a global health university league table and a national student survey on exposure to pharmaceutical marketing. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer
societies.tagline: Welcome to Students for Global Health

societies.name: Sudanese Society
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Surf
societies.description: Imagine trading in your textbooks for a surfboard, your lecture halls for sandy shores, and your coffee breaks for catching the perfect wave. Whether you're a seasoned shredder or a wave rookie, Imperial College Surf Society is here to welcome all riders, beach bums, and water wanderers! During term time, we escape the hustle and bustle of the city on the weekends and head down to the mesmerizing coastal beauty of Cornwall, where the waves are as inviting as the local pasties. But that's not all! Get ready to pack your bags for week-long international surf trips to sun-kissed paradises like Spain, Portugal, and France. With your board and passport in hand, you'll be riding waves in exotic locations, making memories that'll last a lifetime. These trips include lessons and are heavily subsidized, making them budget-friendly and accessible for every adventurer in our crew. Embark on a journey with us for guaranteed good vibes, endless laughter, and friendships that'll last beyond your university days. CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Surgical
societies.description: ICSM Surgical Society was established in 2005 with one key mission: to bring YOU closer to extracurricular surgical training. Formally affiliated with the Royal College of Surgeons, we have since gone on to win the President’s Award (2008) and were highly commended by the Royal College of Surgeons of Edinburgh (2012). What can the society do for you? We are keen to provide members with valuable exam-orientated revision sessions covering anatomy, core surgical topics, practical exam preparation and surgical pathology for all years. Our well-known skills programmes cater for everyone, whether you want to refine your technique for OSCE and PACES exams or practice for a future surgical career. Our calendar's headline, the internationally-renowned Trauma Conference, brings together over 250 delegates from around the world for a unique 2-day event including topical lectures and surgical skills workshops. Our annual program is complemented by our series of careers events and specialties days covering the nuances of the various paths in surgery & their relevant practical skills. Whether you’re an aspiring surgeon or just want some exam help, our events are open to everyone and we look forward to welcoming you soon! Join our award-winning society now to be part of our mission to bring surgical training closer to medical students! CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: SwiftSoc
societies.description: We hope to have socials and listening parties and a group chat to theorise about Easter eggs! It doesn't matter if you are a new Swiftie or if you've been a fan since her Tim McGraw days, whether you are more of a Folkmore fan or a 1989 pop fan, we can't wait to meet you! We also do celebrate all of the sister fandoms so come along if you're a Harry Styles fan, or enjoy girl in red, Phoebe Bridgers, Olivia Rodrigo, Conan Grey, Selena Gomez and all the rest! https://linktr.ee/icswiftsoc Our LinkTree has the links to both our WhatsApp group chat AND our mailing list! Please get our free membership here to the right!

societies.name: Swim and Waterpolo
societies.description: We have 4 Swimming and 4 Waterpolo sessions every week. All sessions in the pool are led by our professional coaches! Our members range from beginners to athletes competing internationally, so provided you’re confident swimming unaided, we've got something for you! With more training, friendly members and social events than you could ever need, ICSWP is a club you will find your home in. If you're looking to improve your technique, we can help you learn a new stroke or perfect your shot. You can dive into both swimming and water polo, with plenty of opportunities to test your skills in friendly competitions against local universities. For those seeking more of a challenge, we compete in the BUCS National Championships (both long and short course) against the best swimmers in the country. Our Men's and Women's Water Polo teams represent Imperial in the BUCS leagues across the UK. We compete in local leagues too, with two mixed teams in the London Water Polo league - great for improving your skills and having some friendly competition at a lower, more relaxed level. Finally, we also have an international Winter Tour and Summer Tour each year - a great time to get to know everyone in the club outside the pool! FB Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/icswp/ Or email swimming@imperial.ac.uk if you have any more questions! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Swiss
societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Synchronized Swimming
societies.description: Do you like swimming, dancing, gymnastics or just team sports? Then join the synchronised swimming team! All levels of synchro swimmers are welcome and your first session is free! We are the Imperial Synchronised Swimming Team open to both experienced artistic swimmers and complete beginners of all genders (as long as you are a confident swimmer). Whether you want to learn a new skill or keep fit at university IC Synchro is the place for you. The club offers anyone of all abilities, the chance to improve (or learn) great technique in the water while having fun (and toning those abs and legs!). We will also improve our flexibility and strength with land training sessions, so if you want to learn to do the splits this year come along! And with training twice a week at Imperial’s South Kensington campus, once in the water and once on land, it is easy to fit synchro in around your busy academic schedule. At the end of the year, everyone will have the chance attend an interuniversity showcase for the public where we will perform routines that fit all levels, including ex-competitive swimmers and those who have only just started. With an amazingly friendly team (who you will get to know at our socials throughout the year) and the possibility to master a new sport you must be tempted... If you want to try something new, join us! Keep your eyes peeled on our social media to see what we’re up to or contact us for more info! Instagram: @icsynchro Email: syncswim@ic.ac.uk CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Synthetic Biology
societies.description: Our mission is to bridge the gap between undergraduates and synthetic biology. We organise seminars with academic and industrial leaders in the field. We also organise Bio-Hackathons at the Advanced Hackspace and are involved in assembling the Imperial Teams for the iGEM, iDEC, and other competitions. We work with the larger SynBioUK network uniting SynBio enthusiasts nationwide. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Table Tennis
societies.description: We have four teams in the BUCS Leagues; one Women’s team and three Men’s teams for those who want to represent Imperial and challenge competitors from other universities. Membership is £35 for the year which allows access to all sessions (bats and balls provided if needed) as well as information on any potential upcoming social events or club activities. CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Tabletop Gaming
societies.description: Monday: Boardgames 6pm Blackett 741. Come by to have a fun time playing some of the various games we have amassed in our vault and meet fellow boardgame enthusiasts. Tuesday and Thursday: Magic the Gathering 6pm Blackett 741. Come and get involved with Magic The Gathering, and play a wide variety of formats, depending on what everyone wants to play each week Wednesday: TTRPG 6pm RSM G.41. Our weekly space for you to fight dragons, overthrow governments, or argue about whether a druid can produce silk when wildshaped into a spider. Friday: Blood on the Clocktower 6pm Blackett 741. Join us for weekly evenings of social deduction as the town roots out the demon(s) in their midst Novice Monopoly player or veteran GM, come join us for good company! For more info, join our Discord server: https://discord.gg/vnbgg75sQM CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Taekwondo
societies.description: But it's not all just about competition! Aside from sporting matters, we take great pride in the ICUTKD team spirit. To ensure this is kept strong, we have an active social schedule, ranging from mini-golf to even formal dinners. Additionally, our strong relations/events with other clubs (e.g. the annual ICUTKD - LSE varsity) allows us to meet people from all over! If you’re interested in joining, please hit us up on our email (icutkd@ic.ac.uk), or Instagram (@icutkd)! We have three sessions a week (Monday, Thursday and Saturday), and we’re welcome for all levels to join, whether a beginner or an olympian - we’re sure you’ll learn something new in every session! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Tea
societies.description: Being an Imperial student can be tough, and it is easy to feel stressed and overwhelmed. TeaSoc provides a place for students to take time out from their busy schedules to relax and have a cup of tea (or multiple!). We meet twice every week on Monday in CAGB 664 and Thursday in an available room, both from 18:15 to 20:15 . Each one of our sessions gives an opportunity to relax and unwind, and includes unlimited tea and delicious snacks for a small fee. Don't forget to bring your friends! We also organise tea trips out - look forward to visits to numerous tea shops around London in our annual Tea Crawl! We also have guest speakers attend from local tea shops, to teach us more about our favourite drink and sample an even wider and exclusive varietea of blends. Sign up to our mailing list at https://mailman.ic.ac.uk/mailman/listinfo/icu-tea for quality teamails! So whether you're a tea fanatic or have only ever drunk Tetley, why not take a break and join us for a cuppa? CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Team Bo'
societies.description: Boanerges, or Bo as he is affectionately known, serves as the City & Guilds College Union's official motorised mascot. Built in 1902, this James & Browne was purchased by Guilds students in 1933 and has remained with the college ever since. Derrick, the 1926 Ner-A-Car is the second motorised mascot of the CGCU. They are some of the most exercised veteran vehicles still on the road, maintained by the dedicated students of Imperial. We take part in the annual London to Brighton Veteran Car Run each November, and we are keen to take out these vehicles for a drive as often as possible throughout the year. Thanks to the early 20th century engineering, we also have plenty of opportunities to get our hands dirty performing maintenance and servicing. Our regular Wednesday afternoon garage sessions are often followed by a well-earned visit to the pub. Don’t worry, these pieces of early British automotive engineering are very simple, you can easily understand how they work, even without previous mechanical experience. If you are keen on cars or motorcycles, looking for a practical, hands-on pastime, or the romance of the early 1900s makes your heart beat faster, we offer beautiful historic vehicles, good company, and fun events throughout the year – get in touch via email or social media. CSP Chair / President

societies.name: TeddyBear Hospital
societies.description: In TeddyBear Hospital we aim to teach children about what it means to be a healthcare professional and what happens in hospitals, in hopes of helping them overcome White Coat Anxiety and inspire them to learn more about Medicine. Every Wednesday we visit a different primary school and teach children about simple topics in Medicine. For example, how to call 999; what exactly a ‘surgery’ is; why washing your hands is important or what is the purpose of a skeleton! At the same time, we provide our volunteers with an opportunity to help the community, practice skills in paediatrics by interacting with children and even improve their teaching skills. We are a very low-commitment group – so you can join us as often or as rarely as you want! So, if you are passionate about teaching children about medicine, looking to do some low-commitment volunteering or simply curious about what we do, join us! If you have any questions, or want to find out more, please drop us a message on social media or by email. Facebook: ICSM Teddybear Hospital Instagram: @icsmteddybear Email: icsmutbh@ic.ac.uk Website: union.ic.ac.uk/medic/tbh/ CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer Communications / Publications Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: TedX
societies.description: CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Tennis
societies.description: The club boasts a long-standing tradition of achievement, especially in recent years, with our Women’s 1s team competing in the BUCS Premier National division, making us one of the Top 6 teams in the country! The Men’s side has also been very successful; our Men’s 1s compete in BUCS Premier South, and our Men’s 3s were crowned league champions in 2025. We cater to players of all abilities, whether you’re a seasoned player or a beginner. Included in club membership are our two weekly social sessions, with courts, balls and coaching advice from more experienced members all provided for free. For our teams, league matches take place weekly throughout Term 1 and 2, and we train indoors at the prestigious Queen’s Club. We take great pride in ensuring our members grow, develop and have fun, both on and off the court. Our ever-expanding social side includes pub crawls, club nights, the annual Christmas dinner and much more. For more information, contact us: Instagram: @iclawntennis Email: lawn.tennis@imperial.ac.uk CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Tennis (ICSM)
societies.description: For competitive and intermediate players, we have 1st and 2nd teams, that both train twice a week on Wednesdays and Sundays and also receive coaching as well as playing in the LUSL mixed leagues against other universities. For beginners and less experienced players, we run more relaxed social tennis sessions every Sunday, with rackets and balls provided. There are also opportunities for social players to get coaching from our LTA-accredited team members throughout the term! ICSM Tennis is an incredibly social club – we are regular attendees of Wednesday sports nights at Reynolds and also run our own socials, which recently have included bowling, ping pong, bbqs and trips to Wimbledon. As well as socials, we love to go on tour – previous domestic destinations include Brighton and Bath, and last year we had an international tour to Tenerife, Spain! For more info, follow and dm our Instagram, @icsmtennis, or email us at medics.tennis@imperial.ac.uk! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Tennis (RSM)
societies.description: The club holds weekly training sessions every Saturday at Ravenscourt Park. These sessions are ran by more experienced players and provide an environment that allows beginners to learn the basics and improve together. It doesn't matter if you have never held a tennis racket before, come along and give the sport a go! Both RSM students and students from the wider College community are welcome to join us. Sign up today by messaging our Instagram (@rsm_tennis) or dropping one of our committee members an email if you are looking for an casual tennis club with no pressure to play. We hope to see you soon! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.description: CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM)
societies.description: Founded upon principles of academic learning, cultural appreciation, and genuine curiosity, this society serves as a platform for students keen on exploring the theories, practices, and applications of TCM. It encompasses areas such as herbal medicine, mind-body practices, acupuncture, and dietary therapy, and examining their scientific foundations. We strive to cultivate a supportive and keen community of learners to engage in aspects of TCM: Whether you practise Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) or are just interested in learning about its principles and methods, we are excited to have you join us. Our committee can’t wait to see you at our events and socials throughout the next academic year and share insights of this centuries-old wisdom! Follow us on Instagram (@ictcm_society) to stay connected and up to date with our events and interesting facts about TCM. Also feel free to join our Whatsapp group chat! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Transplant and Vascular Society
societies.description: Welcome to the Imperial Transplant and Vascular Society! Whether you are a medic, scientist, engineer or simply curious about surgery and innovation, our society is here to bring you closer to the world of transplantation and vascular surgery. From pioneering surgical techniques to cutting-edge research, we aim to inspire the next generation of clinicians and innovators. Our objective is to create a platform where students can learn practical skills, explore new technologies, and connect with leading professionals in these life-changing fields. This year, we are excited to present a wide range of headline events, including: Annual Transplant and Vascular Surgery Teaching Series – hands-on workshops such as AAA repair, AV fistula creation and VR-based training. Cutting Edge Symposium – a major conference featuring world-renowned surgeons, researchers and innovators. Research and Careers Panels – opportunities to understand academic, surgical and industry pathways. Collaborative Socials and Networking Events – meet like-minded peers across medicine, engineering and science in a supportive community. We are proud to be one of the largest societies within the School of Medicine, growing to over 400+ members in just our first year, and continuing to expand with new opportunities, partnerships and innovation. Follow us on social media for updates and events: Want to reach out? Email us at tvsoc@ic.ac.uk CSP Chair / President
societies.tagline: Welcome to Transplant and Vascular Society

societies.name: Triathlon
societies.description: We pride ourselves on being a friendly and inclusive society (we won’t leave you behind on cycles or night outs!). We subsidise tickets for BUCS duathlon, standard and sprint, as well as local triathlons. Last year, we organised a Fresher’s tour and a Summer tour to Club La Santa, Lanzarote; but expect more to come this year! You'll join a tight social community of motivated people and can take advantage of a great training environment in London, as well as getting involved in the Imperial sport nightlife. CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Turkish
societies.description: Join us to dive into a lively environment where you can make new friends, find inspiration and gain valuable networking opportunities. Sizinle tanismayi heyecanla bekliyoruz... Join our whatsapp group at https://chat.whatsapp.com/CqPdqfgQ1ia0LJYZalVqkx and don't forget to follow us on social media! -Your TurkSoc Committee CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Ukrainian
societies.description: We have a strong focus on raising awareness of the ongoing war in Ukraine. We are keen on organizing events to raise money for humanitarian aid, and we aim to promote Ukrainian culture and heritage. We regularly organize cultural events, such as traditional Ukrainian music and dance performances. We are a welcoming and inclusive organization. We are open to students of all nationalities and backgrounds. We are also committed to providing support to Ukrainian students who are studying at Imperial College. CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Venture Capital & Private Equity
societies.description: Venture Capital and Private Equity are two fascinating industries within the alternative investments world, focusing on helping businesses succeed. Our events range from lectures, workshops and career panels to networking and socials. Through this, we connect like-minded individuals and provide them with a holistic overview of the industries. Ultimately, we hope that the insights gained will allow members to break into and thrive in VC & PE. Become a member today for free to join our mailing list and gain access to all of our opportunities. Stay up to date with all of our events and activities through our social media channels: We look forward to seeing you at our events and feel free to contact us if you have any questions! CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Vision
societies.description: We run 3 large conferences every year, consisting of inspirational talks, tutorials, and practical workshops delivered by practising doctors and medical student volunteers. Throughout the year, we run programmes for local schools. We also run other sessions, such as interview mocks, in collaboration with charities and Faculty-ran outreach programmes. CSP Chair / President CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Volleyball
societies.description: Want to have the most amazing time doing a sport that involves 100% teamwork? Have you been playing volleyball all your life or want to have a chance to try it for the first time? Or maybe you started not so long ago and would like to continue playing and being part of a club? Join the IC Volleyball Club if you fit in any of these categories! We have multiple competitive teams and run weekly coached social sessions for beginner and intermediate players. We currently have 4 competitive teams including two men's BUCS, one women's BUCS, and one mixed LUSL team. Aside from trainings, we also organise multiple internal tournament throughout the year, beach volleyball tours, run grass volleyball sessions, and fun socials for anyone in the Imperial community. Check out our social media platforms to learn more about ICVC and feel free to reach out with any questions! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Wakeboarding
societies.description: As one of the fastest growing sports in the world and a contender for the 2020 Olympics, wakeboarding is a thrilling sport that combines surf style fluidity (without the paddling!) with massive snowboard-esque air tricks and as such is a fantastic way to improve your board skills. Best of all, the park is super easy to get to on the train from central London and makes for a fun day out with the rest of the society! For more info about the club and the awesome Freshers Party we throw in October, come say hello at the Freshers Fair and we'll get you onto the water in no time! For more info check out our website: http://wakeimperial.co.uk/ and be sure to join our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/wakeimperial/ CSP Chair / President

societies.name: Water Polo (ICSM)
societies.description: Whether you're a seasoned player or a complete newbie, we have a spot for you. Our competitive and newbie teams train three times a week, offering a perfect balance of intense practice and social enjoyment. Wednesday 1 - 2 pm (swim training) We have a strong presence at Sports Night every week at Reynolds Bar. Our annual domestic and international tours are legendary, and filled with lifelong memories. As one of the few mixed-gender clubs in the med school, we pride ourselves on inclusivity and camaraderie. We prioritize accessibility, ensuring affordable subs and regularly subsidize our Christmas and annual dinners. Benefit from our academic help sessions throughout the year. Join us to make lifelong friends, stay fit, and create unforgettable memories! Dive into fun, fitness, and friendship with the Medics Water Polo Team! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Fundraiser / External Relations Officer

societies.name: Weights & Fitness (ICSM)
societies.description: ICSMSU Weights & Fitness Club is a must for anyone with a passion for exercise and fitness. Originally part of St Mary's Medical School, we run a large hi-spec gym at St Mary's Hospital, this year celebrating its 33rd birthday. The gym boasts the largest free-weights section in Imperial, making us perfect if you're serious about getting bigger. If you just want to get fit, our extensive cardio and resistance sections are perfect if you're in Wilson House or on attachment at St Mary's. Recently reopened after a period of closure due to COVID, we are open again and taking memberships! Do not hesitate to drop into the gym or email us for more information. Happy lifting! CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President

societies.name: Welsh Society
societies.description: We provide a home away from home for Welsh people, those with Welsh heritage or anyone at all interested in Wales at Imperial. Our Wales-themed events include Welsh lessons, meetups at the Union to watch the rugby, pub quizzes and lots more! It doesn't matter whether you're Welsh, interested in learning Welsh, interested in being part of a very welcoming society, emotionally invested in the Gavin and Stacey Xmas Special or just here for the Welsh cakes - we'd love to have you! Be sure to follow us on Instagram (@icwelshsoc) to keep up to date with our latest events, or sign up to our mailing list! We hope to see you soon :) Diolch! CSP Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer

societies.name: Wind Band
societies.description: Performing in termly concerts, supplemented by external social and musical events and an annual summer tour, we aim to provide an enjoyable experience whilst maintaining excellent musical standards. Activities in recent years have included rehearsal weekends to Oxford, tours to Edinburgh, Prague, Munich and Ljubljana and a performance in the RCM's Britten Theatre. We have performed in venues ranging from village halls to the famous beer hall Hofbräuhaus to a rugby stadium in front of over a thousand spectators. This year we’re also running both Flute Choir and Clarinet Choir: 2 sub-groups rehearsing from 16:45 to 18:00 every Tuesday in the Blyth Centre. Conducted by Wind Band’s music director Alan Shellard, both groups have a few performances each year in Wind Band concerts and busking sessions. These groups are open to all flautists and clarinettists, not just those who play in Wind Band – if you like playing with other flutes or clarinets, or want to try other types of flutes or clarinets, then flute and clarinet choir are for you! societies.name: Women in Business
societies.description: build a network of aspiring women. We intend to do this by providing them with the necessary skills required to be at the forefront of any business. Our mission is to equip our members with the tools to enter the business world through  access to an incredible network of supportive women, exclusive resources, and connections with leading employers. Our society holds number of inspirational events through the year such as soft skill building workshops, mentorship programs, Q&A's, informal coffee chats with employers and and office visits! Connect with us and reach out with any questions! Email: imperialwib@imperial.ac.uk Facebook: Imperial College Women in Business Instagram: @imperialwib LinkedIn: Imperial College Women in Business (ICWB) CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer Events / Trips Officer

societies.name: Women in SET
societies.description: Furthermore, we partner with global companies to bring you CV workshops, interview and internship advice, company insights etc. and help you grow your network. Our annual events include: 1) Annual Industry Networking Event: all our sponsors are invited and offer a large networking platform 2) International Women's Day Formal Dinner: our members get the chance to have a fancy 3-course meal sitting right next to senior female representatives coming from our sponsor firms! We held it at the Dorchester Hotel with 100 people in 23/24! We also raise awareness about STEM opportunities among girls at high schools. We have partnered with charities and conduct STEM workshops at different schools and encourage students to pursue a career in STEM - great opportunity to volunteer with us! We also plan talks with renowned academics from Imperial and other unis to talk about their work and challenges faced throughout their career. Lastly, we plan A LOT of social events: movie nights, boat parties, bowling, dinners, picnics and more! Some of our sponsors include: Google, Bloomberg, Bank of America, Jane Street, Marshall Wace, Jefferies, ARM and more! So, join us (for free!) to be a part of Imperial’s largest community of women and help shape your career! societies.name: Yoga
societies.description: IC Yoga Club welcomes students, staff and alumni interested in practising yoga and meditation to join us for our affordable weekly classes. The classes are suitable for all levels, from complete beginners to advanced yogis. Our professionally trained teachers will guide you through their chosen form of the practice. Whether you'd like to get fit, de-stress, or become more flexible, you'll find a style of practice suitable for you. CSP Chair / President CSP Vice Chair / President Communications / Publications Officer
